title: columbia_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the US Navy light cruiser USS [i]Columbia[/i] (CL-56) in [[Azur Lane]]. Character design by [[Hao (patinnko)|]], voiced by Horigome Saya.

In-game, she is portrayed having [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] and [[red eyes]], with [[sunglasses]] on her head. She is wearing a blue-white shirt with a [[star print]], [[dog tags]], [[blue shorts]], [[brown belt]], and a striped [[single thighhigh]] on her left leg.

Her rig is the same as her sisters, with two 15.2 cm triple mounts on one side and two 12.7 cm twin mounts on another. Unlike [[Montpelier (Azur Lane)|]], she does not have 20 mm Oerlikon AA guns on her rig.

She is also shown [[chewing gum|chewing on bubble gum]] in her base art. 

h4. Skins

* !post #3060301: Default
* !post #3800590: [[columbia (after-school odette) (azur lane)|After-School Odette]]
* !post #5089055: [[columbia (across the vast prairies) (azur lane)|Across the Vast Prairies]]

h4. History
In real life, Columbia was among the first of her class to enter service alongside Cleveland, Montpelier, and Denver (the so-called "Solomon Knights"/Cruiser Division 12). Together they saw service at the battles of Rennell Island and Empress Augusta Bay.
She later joined Denver in the battle of Leyte Gulf, facing off against "Nishimura's fleet.":/pools/9549

After seeing further service in Lingayen Gulf and Borneo, she was decommissioned in 1946.

title: cleveland_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the light cruiser USS [i]Cleveland[/i] (CL-55) in [[Azur Lane]]. Character design by [[Hao (patinnko)|]].

She has [[blonde hair]] in either a [[ponytail]] or [[one side up]], [[small breasts]], and [[red eyes]]. Her outfit consists of a fire-control director holding up her sidetail, a [[white cape]], [[blue jacket]], a very small [[miniskirt]], and star-spangled [[socks]].
Her [[rigging]] is the standard for her class, with two 15.2 cm triple mounts on the left and two 12.7 cm twin mounts on the right.

Cleveland is often nicknamed "Clevedad" by Chinese players, a carryover from [[world_of_warships|World of Warships]], similar to [[Belfast (azur lane)|]]'s nickname "Payfast" used by Western players, and also bears the nickname "Clevebro" due to her tomboyish and cavalier attitude.

She is sometimes wearing [[deal with it (meme)|]] [[sunglasses]], due to their use in one her emotes.

title: tiki_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Tiki[/b] (Chiki) is a playable character in several games of the [[Fire Emblem]] series of strategy RPGs. She is the Princess of the Divine Dragon tribe, and therefore much older than she appears to be. She first appears as a 500-year-old child in [[Fire Emblem: Shadow Dragon and the Blade of Light]] and [[Fire Emblem: Mystery of the Emblem]], and reappears [[aged up|as an adult]] 2,000 years later in [[Fire Emblem Awakening]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[green hair]] in a [[ponytail]], [[green eyes]] and [[pointy ears]]. [[Tiki_(young)_(fire_emblem)|As a child]], she wears a [[short dress|short]] [[pink dress|pink]] [[dress]], while [[Tiki_(adult)_(fire_emblem)|as an adult]] she wears a short [[red dress|red]] [[strapless dress]] with [[side slit]]s, a pink [[cape]], red [[thigh boots]] over pink [[thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]] and red [[gloves]]. As both a child and an adult she has a [[hair ornament]] above her forehead.

In-game, her class is Manakete, which gives her the power to change into [[dragon]] form in combat via use of a dragonstone.

Remarkably, her Awakening incarnation ended in the Top 1 of the 2022's Edition of "Choose Your Legends":[https://vote6.campaigns.fire-emblem-heroes.com/en-US/result] (women's side).

h4. Appearance

* !post #2618252: [[tiki (young) (fire emblem)|Young]]
* !post #2620141: [[tiki (adult) (fire emblem)|Adult]]

title: tharja_(fire_emblem)
body:
Playable character in [[Fire Emblem Awakening]].

Tharja is a Dark Mage who hails from Plegia, though she does not care about the conflict between Plegia and Ylisse. After joining [[chrom (fire emblem)|Chrom]]'s army, she falls in love with the [[Robin (Fire Emblem)|Avatar]], even if the Avatar is female. Her support with [[nowi (fire emblem)|Nowi]] reveals that she has the power to read fortunes using a Manakete's claw, and can divine the location of anyone or anything using one.

She is well versed with curses, ranging from a constant runny nose curse to a cooling hex to bring down fevers. She has the nicest body in the army and has the darkest thoughts. She is the mother of [[noire (fire emblem)|Noire]] and a potential mother of [[morgan_(fire emblem)|Morgan]]. Her birthday is April 2nd. 

She is voiced by Kana Akutsu ([[Takada Yuuki]] since 2016) in the Japanese version and by [[Stephanie Sheh]] in the English version.

title: tsunomaki_watame_(watame_night_fever!!)
body:
The 6th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Tsunomaki Watame]].

In this costume, she wears a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white dress]] with a [[white belt]] an [[o-ring thigh strap|white o-ring]] [[thigh strap]] [[black thighhighs]] and [[black boots|black]] [[boots]]. This costume also comes in with either a [[white shirt]] or a [[black shirt]] with [[clothes writing|words on it]] saying "Watame Night Fever!!", the name of her reoccurring karaoke streams and of her 1st solo 3D concert. Her breast size is also noticeably [[large breasts|larger]] in this costume, rivaling even that of [[Shirogane Noel]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume, she has her [[long hair]] tied into a [[ponytail]] with partial bangs, with the left hand side of her bangs decorated with three hair clips.

title: intrepid_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the aircraft carrier USS [i]Intrepid[/i] (CV-11) in [i][[Azur Lane]][/i]. Character design by [[Xiao Chichi]], voiced by [[Fairouz Ai]].

Intrepid has [[grey eyes]] and [[grey hair]] tied into a [[two side up]]. She wears a uniform of similar design to Essex, though hers features a low cut [[strapless dress|strapless]] [[black dress]] [[short dress|short]] with red and white accents and "USS" written vertically. She has a [[blue cloak]] with a closed [[high collar]]. Additionally, she wears [[black thighhighs]] and [[black gloves]].  

Her rigging consists of two full [[flight deck]]s, which split amidships to form four separate flight decks.

title: bunker_hill_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the aircraft carrier USS [i]Bunker Hill[/i] (CV-17). Character design by [[Kexue]], voiced by [[Ichinose Kana]].

She is portrayed with [[very long hair|very long]] [[blonde hair]] with a [[black rose]] [[hair flower]] adorning the right side of her hair. Her uniform is near identical to [[Essex (Azur Lane)|Essex]]. She wears a low cut [[blue dress]] with red and white accents as well as her name written vertically along the left side. She has a [[blue cloak]] with a closed [[high collar]] as well as a [[red necktie]]. She wears [[black pantyhose]] and [[black footwear]] [[boots]].

Her [[rigging]] is an asymmetrical pair of [[flight deck|flight decks]]. On her right is the longer flight deck which splits width-wise, about two-thirds from the stern, as well as a hull. On her left is the short flight deck which is marked with the number 17.

h4. Skins
* !post #3457118: Default
* !post #4457533: [[Bunker Hill (Mission Relaxation) (Azur Lane)|Mission Relaxation]] (gamer)

h4. Related Characters

* [[Intrepid (Azur Lane)|]] (CV-11)

title: bon_homme_richard_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the Essex-class aircraft carrier USS [i]Bon Homme Richard[/i] in [[Azur Lane]], currently a story-only character.

She was historically named after:
* John Paul Jones' eponymous frigate from the American Revolutionary War
* [[Benjamin Franklin]] (albeit rendered as "Bonhomme Richard")

h4. Appearance
Unlike the other [i]Essex[/i]-class carriers already implemented, [i]Bon Homme Richard[/i] is depicted in a younger physical form, and it is implied to be the form that she will appear in her normal Eagle Union Faction form. She sports [[short hair|short]] [[white hair]] with a [[belt]] [[hairband]] that is reminiscent of [[Shirogane Noel]]. She has [[blue eyes]] in her Eagle Union form.

title: ticonderoga_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the aircraft carrier USS [i]Ticonderoga[/i] (CV-14). Character design by [[Tomohiro Kai]], voiced by [[Ichinose Kana]].

She is portrayed with [[very long hair|very long]], pale [[blue hair]], adorned with what looks like a [[bird of paradise flower]] on the left side of her head. Her uniform is much more form-fitting compared to [[Essex (Azur Lane)|Essex]] and her sisters; her clothing emphasizes her [[large breasts]] more, by way of a blue-on-black [[sleeveless shirt]] held together with a pair of belts, and [[clothing cutout| clothing cutouts]] right at her waist area. She also wears a pair of elbow-length [[fingerless gloves]], and a microskirt to complement her [[thighhighs]]; the latter also emphasizes the [[mole]] on the inner side of her left thigh. The only thing she shares with her sisters would be the [[coat cape]].

Her [[rigging]] is an asymmetrical pair of [[flight deck|flight decks]], much like her sister Bunker Hill; but unlike the latter, her right flight deck is straight.

title: shangri-la_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the [i]Essex[/i]-class carrier USS [i]Shangri-La[/i] in [[Azur Lane]]. Character design by [[Kexue]], voiced by [[Fujita Akane (voice Actor)|]].

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]], [[grey eyes]] with [[glasses]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of the typical [i]Essex[/i]-class garb: [[blue cloak]] with a five-pointed star representing the Eagle Union faction, [[blue dress]] with [[cleavage cutout]], and a [[red necktie]]. She also wears [[snowflake hair ornament]]s, [[grey socks]], and black [[boots]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is also shared with the rest of the class: a split [[flight deck]] arrangement. Instead of her hull number, she has the letter "Z" painted forward "as it was when Japan surrendered":[https://www.navsource.org/archives/02/023805.jpg] to signify occupation duties.

title: essex_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the US Navy aircraft carrier USS [i]Essex[/i] (CV-9) in [[Azur Lane]]. Character design by [[Kexue]], voiced by [[Mizuhashi Kaori]].

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] tied into a pair of [[twintails]], [[medium breasts]], and [[brown eyes]]. Her uniform is a low cut [[blue dress]] with red and white accents as well as "Essex" written vertically along her front-left, and a red [[necktie]]. Over this is an open [[blue cloak]] with vertical slits along the full length of the sides along her arms to reach through. She wears a pair of [[black pantyhose]], and a pair of [[boots]] with red and white stripes on the top flaps.

Her [[rigging]] is composed of a [[crossbow]] with a mini [[flight deck]] on top marked "9," and two mounted flight decks. Comparing these to [[Intrepid (Azur Lane)|]], it is likely these split along the width at point about halfway along the length of the flight deck.

Her [[chibi]] [[essex face|face]] became somewhat of a meme inside community.

title: charge_blade
body:
Known as "charge axe" in Japan. A type of weapon introduced to the [[monster hunter (series)|Monster Hunter]] series as of [[monster_hunter_4|Monster Hunter 4]]. The weapon comes in two parts - a [[sword]] and a [[shield]] - which can be either used separately, or combined to form a large [[axe]].

The strategy of using the weapon's two forms generally revolves around using the sword to charge energy and the shield for defense, then using the energy by switching to axe mode to deliver large amounts of damage.

title: ferdinand_von_aegir
body:
Character in [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]] and member of the Black Eagles.

Ferdinand is a confident and competitive noble, he strives to become better than [[Edelgard von Hresvelg|Edelgard]] in order to prove himself. Unlike other nobles, he does not look down upon commoners as many other nobles do. He is willing to understand what he did wrong and desires to improve himself when someone takes issue of him.

title: felix_hugo_fraldarius
body:
Character from [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]].

He is a sharp-tongued swordsman who likes training. His older brother, Glenn, was betrothed to [[Ingrid Brandl Galatea]], but perished during the Tragedy of Duscur. He often refers to [[Dimitri Alexandre Blaiddyd]] as the "boar prince" due to the latter's bloodlust.

In-game, Felix has very high Speed and Strength, making him ideal to become a Swordmaster, but his durability is unimpressive.

Voiced by "Lucien Dodge":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lucien_Dodge] (English), "Jose Yuuichi":[https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/encyclopedia/people.php?id=142068] (Japanese).

title: sylvain_jose_gautier
body:
Playable character in [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]] and member of the Blue Lions.

While he values his friends and acts as an older brother figure to them, he has a habit of being a skirt chaser and often ends up getting in trouble as a result, he is childhood friends with [[Dimitri Alexandre Blaiddyd|Dimitri]], [[Felix Hugo Fraldarius|Felix]] and [[Ingrid Brandl Galatea|Ingrid]].

In-game, Sylvain is a balanced and flexible character who initially serves best as a Cavalier, but can fit into virtually any role with enough effort, with only his Dexterity being slightly below average.

Voiced by: Joe Brogie (English), [[Furukawa Makoto]] (Japanese).

title: petra_macneary
body:
A character from [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]] who hails from an archipelago named Brigid. She is the granddaughter of Brigid's king, and is thus a princess, yet she is studious and has a great work ethic. However, she has trouble speaking the language of Fódlan, which is shown in the Japanese version by her speaking in a slow and stilted manner (as if she has trouble finding the words), and in the English version by her using unusual grammar and not using contractions ("I am pleased to be meeting with...no, I am pleased to have met you.").

Has [[long_hair|long]] [[purple hair]], [[brown eyes]], and [[medium breasts]] that grow into [[large breasts]] as she gets older. She also sports a [[facial mark]] under her right eye.

h4. Appearance 

* !post #3588629

* !post #7807348: [[petra macneary (summer)|Summer]]

title: mercedes_von_martritz
body:
A character from [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]] and a member of the Blue Lions.

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] (though she cuts it [[short_hair|short]] after the in-game timeskip), [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]].

A motherly and religious woman, Mercedes can't ignore people in need, being always prone to help her friends if there's a problem. She tends to let people tell her what to do, rationalizing this to be the will of the Goddess. She is good friends with [[annette_fantine_dominic|Annette]].

In-game, Mercedes is one of the best healers available to the player, being one of only two characters with access to the Fortify spell (the other being [[flayn_(fire_emblem)|Flayn]]). She also does reasonably well with offensive magic, but she has terrible physical stats.

[spoilers]Mercedes's half-brother is [[Jeritza von Hrym]], who was once known as Emile von Bartels. The two were separated when Emile's father, Baron Bartels, attempted to dispose of her and her mother.[/spoilers]

body:
[b]Shigure[/b] (シグレ) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

He is the son of [[azura_(fire_emblem)|Azura]] and inherited her beautiful singing voice. Shigure has a natural love for the arts and is especially fond of singing like his mother. He loves high places.

title: ingrid_brandl_galatea
body:
A playable character from [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]] from the Kingdom of Faerghus. Ingrid is a member of the Blue Lions, and aspires to become a knight.

She has [[blonde hair]], [[green eyes]], and [[medium breasts]]. She bears a Minor [[Crest of Daphnel]].

In-game, Ingrid has high speed and above-average magic resistance, making her ideal as a Pegasus Knight, but she has mediocre strength and low physical durability. She is one of the few characters in the game to have no skill weaknesses, letting her promote into just about any class with enough effort.

title: dorothea_arnault
body:
A character from [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]]. Dorothea is a former songstress who is part of the Black Eagles house. She serves as a potent mage and potential love interest of [[Byleth_(fire_emblem)|]], regardless of Byleth's gender. She is also (arguably) the game's best pick for the Dancer class.

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[brown hair]], [[green eyes]], and a [[curvy]] figure with [[large breasts]], and typically shows off her [[cleavage]].

Not to be confused with [[Dorothy (Fire Emblem)|]] from [[Fire Emblem: The Binding Blade]].

title: maya_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s depiction of Sakura Empire Takao-class heavy cruiser, IJN [i]Maya[/i] (摩耶).

Maya is a bit of black sheep in comparison to her sisters. In her base art (see post #2961792), she has [[short hair|short]] [[white hair]] in comparison to her sisters' long black hair. She has perked up [[dog ears]] like Atago. She wears a [[long sleeves|long sleeved]], [[black serafuku]] instead of the white naval uniform her sisters wear, alongside a [[white scarf]], [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]] and black [[loafers]]. Her [[rigging]] is composed of 5 twin-[[ship turret|turrets]], 2 quad [[torpedo tubes]] and 2 [[smokestack|smokestacks]].

She is voiced by [[Oonishi Saori]].

h4. Skins

title: kanojo_okarishimasu
body:
A romcom manga series written and illustrated by [[Miyajima Reiji]], first published in 2017.
The male protagonist [[Kinoshita Kazuya]], gets dumped by his girlfriend [[Nanami Mami]]. To relieve his sorrow, he decides to try out a "girlfriend" rental service, and there he meets the breathtaking beauty [[Mizuhara Chizuru]]. As the professional she is, she keeps "business" and private separate. Soon, however, their private lives start to get intermingled in ways none of them could imagine...

An anime adaptation by TMS Entertainment aired from July to September 2020, and there is a second season airing in Summer 2022.

English Title: [i]Rent-a-Girlfriend[/i]

h4. Characters

* [[Kinoshita Kazuya]]
* [[Mizuhara Chizuru]]
* [[Nakano Umi]]
* [[Nanami Mami]]
* [[Sakurasawa Sumi]]
* [[Sarashina Ruka]]

title: donnel_(fire_emblem)
body:
Donnel ([b]Denis[/b] in Japan, [b]Donnel Tinhead[/b] in the Western version) is a character of the Villager class in [[Fire Emblem Awakening]].

A young man from the countryside that joins the Shepherds after they protect his town from being razed by bandits. He has an astonishing learning ability, reflected by his Aptitude perk in-game, which allows him to increase each of his stats each time he reaches a level.

He can be obtained during the first Paralogue. If he reaches Level 4 at any point during the Paralogue, he will automatically join your party at the end.

Voiced by Ichiki Mitshuhiro in the Japanese version and Sam Riegel in the NA version.

title: arifureta_shokugyou_de_sekai_saikyou
body:
[b]Arifureta Shokugyou de Sekai Saikyou[/b] is a light novel written by Chuuni Suki (白米良 / 厨二好き) and illustrated by [[Takayaki]]. 

h4. Synopsis
Among the class that was transported to another world, Nagumo Hajime is an ordinary male student who doesn't have ambition nor aspiration in life, called "Incompetent" by his classmates. The class is summoned to become heroes and save a country from destruction, students of the class are blessed with cheat specs and cool job classes, but that's not the case with Hajime, his job class is a "Synergist" and his stats are very normal (mediocre). "Synergist," to put it in another word is just the artisan class. Being the weakest, he then falls to the depth of the abyss when he and his classmates are exploring a dungeon. What did he find in the depth of the abyss and can he survive?

h4. Characters
* [[Nagumo Hajime]]
* [[Yue (arifureta)|]]
* [[Shea Haulia]]
* [[Tio Clarce]]
* [[Shirasaki Kaori]]
* [[Yaegashi Shizuku]]
* [[Hatayama Aiko]]
* [[David Zahler]]
* [[Sonobe Yuuka]]

h4. Genre
Action  Adventure  Fantasy  Harem  Psychological  Romance  Seinen  

h4. External links
https://www.mangaupdates.com/series.html?id=113398
http://over-lap.co.jp/narou/865540550/

title: kudamaki_tsukasa
body:
Midboss of [[Touhou]] [[Unconnected Marketeers]]. A kuda-gitsune (pipe/tube fox), capable of slipping into places where one is weak. She never has a role as a boss character in the game, but still has dialogue despite her midboss standing.

She is a [[fox girl]] with [[brown eyes]], [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]], [[fox ears]] and [[fox tail|tail]]. She wears a [[white romper]] decorated with [[green ribbon]]s on her [[neck ribbon|neck]] and [[sleeve ribbon|sleeves]]. In her official art, her right hand makes a [[fox shadow puppet]] pose, while her left hand holds a [[corked bottle|corked]] [[test tube]]. She wears [[white socks|white]] [[ankle socks]] on her feet.

title: dakimakura_(medium)
body:
A dakimakura is a Japanese [[body pillow]] printed with anime characters, usually as a [[full body|full-length portrait]], [[lying]] on [[bed sheet]]s, and frequently in a state of [[undressing|undress]] or nightwear.

Many dakimakura are two-sided, showing the character clothed on one side and [[nude]] (or less clothed) on the other. These dakimakura should be tagged [[multiple views]] and not [[solo]].

Use this tag for images featuring dakimakura designs, such as post #900422.  When a dakimakura is included as an object in the picture, use [[dakimakura (object)]] instead.

Use [[double dakimakura (medium)|]] for dakis that have two characters in them.

title: tabi
body:
A kind of traditional Japanese [[socks|sock]]. Modern tabi resemble regular socks, only there is a division between the big toe and the other toes, and the soles are usually thicker. Historically, Tabi are commonly made of inelastic materials such as [[leather]] and cotton and have fasteners at the back due to its origin as indoor footwear, but modern Tabi also use stretchable fabrics. For socks with division between all toes use [[toe socks]] instead. 

For tabi that are used as footwear, use [[jika-tabi]] instead.

h4. See also
* [[Japanese clothes]]
* [[jika-tabi]]
* [[socks]]
* [[Miko]]
* [[Ninja]]
* [[Zouri]]
* [[waraji]]
* [[toe socks]]
* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

title: piston
body: A cylindrical mechanical component that moves back and forth inside a similarly shaped chamber (often called a cylinder). Commonly associated with internal combustion engines, pumps, and various machinery, a piston transfers force by converting expanding gas or fluid pressure into mechanical motion—or vice versa.

title: frank_tenpenny
body:
Frank Tenpenny is a character and main antagonist in [[Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas]]. 

A corrupt Los Santos police officer, he leads [b]CRASH[/b] (Community Resources Against Street Hoodlums), a police unit originally created to combat the gangs of Los Santos and the rising illegal drug trade, but has since become corrupt by also being involved in criminal activities including working with the drug gangs. Throughout the game, Tenpenny forces the main character [[Carl Johnson]] to help him cover up his corruption by threatening his family. 

Tenpenny is voiced by [[Samuel L. Jackson]] while the character is based on [[real life]] [[Los Angeles]] Police officer Rafael Pérez, who was arrested for his crimes in the late 1990s when the CRASH unit he was in was exposed for corruption.

title: rin_penrose
body:
An English-speaking [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]]. Debuted as a member of the EN branch of [[Idol Corp|Idol]], before graduating as an [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]].

As a [[prince|Royal Prince]], going for a [[multicolored|split-color]] look, her outfit mostly consists of a [[two-tone shirt|black and white shirt]] with a [[ribbon|purple ribbon]] and [[thigh boots|black thigh boots]]. She has [[split-color hair]] that is both [[black hair|black]] and [[white hair|white]], she has [[heterochromia]] with one side being [[red eyes|red]] and the other being [[blue eyes|blue]].

Can sometimes be seen depicted with [[ikea shark|BLÅHAJ]] plushes, as a result of her love for the plush, to the point of being the self-declared "Prince of BLÅHAJ" and really wanting an IKEA sponsorship.

h4. See also

title: list_of_commonly_misused_tags
body:
h4. Mutually exclusive tags

The following cannot be used to describe the same object or situation

* [[ambiguous gender]] <-> [[androgynous]]
* [[bare pectorals]] <-> ([[topless male]], [[nude]], [[breastless clothes]] or [[underwear only]])
* [[bottomless]] <-> [[bare legs]] 
* [[greyscale]] <-> [[grey theme]]
* [[hands in opposite sleeves]] <-> [[sleeves past wrists]]
* [[hairband]] <-> [[headband]]
* [[jersey]] <-> [[track jacket]]
* [[looking at viewer]] <-> ([[facing viewer]] or [[closed eyes]] or [[blindfold]])
* [[nude]] <-> ([[bare shoulders]] or [[bare legs]] or [[bare arms]] or [[topless female]] or [[bottomless]])
* [[official alternate costume]] <-> [[alternate costume]]
** [[official alternate hairstyle]] <-> [[alternate hairstyle]]
** [[official alternate hair length]] <-> [[alternate hair length]]
* ([[off-shoulder shirt]]/[[off-shoulder dress|dress]]/[[off-shoulder sweater|sweater]]) <-> ([[strapless]] [[strapless shirt|shirt]]/[[strapless dress|dress]] or [[tube top]]) <-> ([[sleeveless]] [[sleeveless shirt|shirt]]/[[sleeveless dress|dress]]/[[sleeveless sweater|sweater]])
* [[playboy bunny]] <-> ([[kittysuit]] or [[rabbit costume]])
* [[solo]] <-> ([[solo focus]] or [[multiple views]])
* [[striped bikini]] <-> [[white bikini]]
* [[topless female]] <-> ([[nude]] or [[bare shoulders]] or [[bare arms]])
* [[x-ray]] <-> [[cross-section]]
* [[miko]] <-> [[nontraditional miko]]

h4. Specific mistagging

h5. Places

* [[changing room]]/[[dressing room]]/[[fitting room]]/[[locker room]]
** Not to be used interchangeably for just any rooms where a character would get dressed and/or undressed.
** [[Changing room]]s are the ones where people remove and store their clothes, usually when going to a [[pool]] or an [[onsen]].
** [[Dressing room]]s are the ones used by on-stage performers to change in and out of their costumes.
** [[Fitting room]]s are the tiny ones in clothing stores where individual customers can try on clothes before buying them.
** [[Locker room]]s are similar to changing rooms, but [[locker]]s must be visible.

h5. Objects

* [[animal ears]]
** Do not use for actual animals, which have these by default.
* [[costume switch]]
** Applicable only if there are multiple characters, to be sure there is a switch.
** Not applicable on single-character [[cosplay]] pictures. Add the appropriate cosplay tag instead.
** Not applicable on parent-child pairs of single-character [[cosplay]] posts.
** Not the same as a "costume change."
* [[crescent moon]]
** Do not tag for just [[crescent]] shaped objects, e.g. [[crescent hair ornament]]
* [[goat horns]]
** Commonly mistagged on [[sheep horns]]. Goat horns traditionally do not curl all the way around.
* [[naked towel]]
** Character must be wearing the towel, not just having it on their person
* [[no humans]]
** Does not apply to human-like characters such as [[humanoid robot]]s and [[furry|furries]].
* [[off-shoulder jacket]]/[[off-shoulder coat]]/[[off-shoulder cardigan]]
** Should be used when the jacket, coat, or cardigan is naturally designed with a low and wide-cut neckline.
** Do not use for open/partially open jackets/coats/cardigans that are simply worn hanging off the upper arms.
* [[red glasses]]
** See either [[red-framed eyewear]] or [[red-tinted eyewear]]
* [[see-through clothes]]/[[transparent]]
** See-through is for clothing, transparent is for other objects.
* [[short hair]]
** Not for [[medium hair|shoulder-length hair]]
* [[silhouette]]
** Not for mere [[shadow]]s behind objects; should be mostly featureless
* [[vaginal]]
** If female character's genital is visible, tagging [[pussy]] is mandatory. 
* [[miko]]
** Only to be used if a character is wearing the actual traditional outfit of a miko: a [[hakama skirt]] (almost always entirely red) and white kosode or kimono. Otherwise, use [[nontraditional miko]] instead.

h5. Meta

* [[casual]]
** Not for characters that always appear in casual clothing
* [[contemporary]]
** Not for characters that always appear in contemporary settings
* [[humanization]]
** Refers to characters that were already humanoid to begin with being depicted as fully human; depictions of non-humanoids as humans belong under [[personification]]
* [[orc]] and [[ogre]]
** Orcs are commonly depicted with a green-skinned muscular or chubby body and sports a tusks, while ogres usually have a fat body and lacks any tusks.
* [[text focus]]
** Only when text is a major component of an image

h5. Actions

* [[squirting liquid]]
** Not for [[female ejaculation]]
* [[facing viewer]]
** Only for characters with [[closed eyes|closed]] or [[covered eyes]]
* [[floating]]
** When on water, use [[afloat]] instead
* [[partially submerged]]
** Not for just [[sitting]] in [[shallow water]]
* [[air guitar]]
** This is for pretending to play a guitar [i]without holding anything[/i]. Pretending to play guitar with anything but a guitar is using an [[unconventional guitar]].
* [[riding]]
** Only for characters riding an [[animal]] or a [[motor vehicle]], use [[girl on top]] or [[boy on top]], and [[cowgirl position]] for posts depicting a person having sex on top of another person.
* [[takeoff]]
** Only for characters or [[aircraft]]s leaving the ground. Use [[undressing]] for images depicting someone taking off their clothes.

h4. See also

* topic #14603 (Commonly misused tags)

title: midriff
body:
A moderately-sized rectangular gap between clothing that exposes the character's [[stomach]]. The total amount of exposed skin should equal no more than half the stomach’s surface; with waistline bottomwear the gap ends slightly above the [[navel]], though it can shift to accommodate "high-waist clothing":[/posts?tags=high-waist_*].

Use midriff when there are regular clothes above (e.g. a [[crop top]]) and below (e.g. [[pants]]) the stomach, but the stomach is bare or visible beneath [[see-through clothes|see-through]] clothing. "Regular" is not limited to "real apparel":[/posts/4355324].

h6. Midriff is not/should not be used for:

* A substitute for stomach, or implicated by it.
* Characters that are [[topless female]]/[[topless male]], [[bottomless]], or [[nude]].
* Characters wearing any form of [[swimsuit]], most often [[bikini]]s, [[bikini top only]], or [[bikini bottom only]].
* Characters wearing any type of underwear, such as [[bra]]s and [[panties]], unless they're visible beneath normal clothing.*
* An [[upper body]] shot that features qualifying topwear, but no bottom is visible.

[b]Note:[/b] Midriff may still apply to otherwise disqualifying clothing if it is "underwear worn as outerwear":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Underwear_as_outerwear], such as [[sports bra]]s, [[camisole]]s, [[tank top]]s worn with panties, etc.

h4. Examples

* !post #7380884
* !post #7317409
* !post #7378098
* !post #7345459

h4. See also

* [[Crop top]]
* [[Crop top overhang]]
* [[Cropped jacket]]
* [[Cropped shirt]]
* [[Midriff peek]]

title: uss_enterprise_(cv-6)
body:
An American [i]Yorktown[/i]-class [[aircraft carrier]] that fought in [[World War II]]. She was nicknamed "Big E", "Lucky E", "The Grey Ghost", and "The Galloping Ghost".

She fought in almost all of the battles in the Pacific Campaign and was considered a lucky ship due to surviving major damages and hardships. The [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] mistakenly believed they had sunk her on multiple occasions, only to encounter her again in later battles. Having earned twenty battle stars and numerous other awards, Enterprise was the most decorated U.S. ship of WWII, though contrary to popular belief is not the most decorated U.S. ship of all time. 

After the war, several attempts were made to raise enough money to buy her from the US Navy and preserve her as a museum ship, but they all failed to reach the amount of money to do so. She was scheduled for scrapping on July 1, 1958 and was completely scrapped on May 1960.

h4. See also

* [[Enterprise (Pacific)]]
* [[Enterprise (Warship Girls R)]]
* [[Enterprise (Azur Lane)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: USS Enterprise (CV-6)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Enterprise_%28CV-6%29

title: lunasia_(girls'_frontline)
body:
A character in [[Girls' Frontline]].

[spoiler]Though her precise origins were unknown at first, clones of hers with altered memories would be sent on a quest for vengeance against G&K, resulting in their deaths. Upon recovering one of the bodies and discovering the similarity her brain appeared to have to a T-Doll's Neural Cloud, [[Persica (girls' frontline)|]] went ahead and scanned the corpse's brain, utilizing the data to create a Neural Cloud model. She would lend a copy to former colleague [[Lycoris (girls' frontline)|]], who'd go on to create [[Elisa (girls' frontline)|]] with it, while Persica would use the model to create the [[Anti-Rain (girls' frontline)|AR Team]], using varying amounts of the scans for each member, [[M4A1 (girls' frontline)|]] embodying the most, and [[RO635 (girls' frontline)|]] the least, with her instead using it as a basis for the next gen of dolls, making her more stable and duplicable.

As a result of the amount of scan data that was used for her, M4A1 would be recognized by Elisa and [[Dandelion (girls' frontline)|her OGAS]] as "Lunasia."[/spoiler]
[spoiler]The [[Nyto (girls' frontline)|]]s bare a resemblance to not just M4A1, but Lunasia as well, and it would be revealed that not only is the leader of [[Paradeus]] [[William (reverse collapse)|]], but that he had been the one to make the clones. The intent behind his usage of Lunasia as a cloning specimen becomes clearer from Chapter 13 on, once it is revealed that he is in fact the brother to the original Lunasia (and in turn, daughter of [[Rudolf von Oberstein]]).[/spoiler]
[spoiler]The events in Cartesian Theater and Angular Gyrus (Chapter 15.2/15.4) would see Lunasia return through the possession of M4A1's body, for reasons which this wiki page is not fit to explain.[/spoiler]

Shares a similar name to one of the Three Goddesses of [[Codename: Bakery Girl]], translated into English as Lunasia too (露尼西亚 in GF vs. 露尼西娅 in Bakery Girl; the distinction has prompted some to continue using the older fan-translation of Lunixya for this character). She's otherwise distinguished as "Test Subject G-264 Lunasia".

h4. Appearance

* !post #6584844: Young Lunasia
* !post #6584804: "Poincaré Recurrence" event hologram (M4A1-inspired)
* !post #9024444: In Frankfurt (example)

h4. See also

* [[List of Girls' Frontline characters]]

h4. External links

* "IOP Wiki: Lunasia":[https://iopwiki.com/wiki/Lunasia]

title: subnautica
body:
A 2018 survival game developed by Unknown Worlds Entertainment.

The player controls [[Ryley Robinson]], a survivor of a spaceship crash on an alien oceanic planet, which they are free to explore. The game features a large variety of fictional sea creatures and submersible equipment/vehicles.

A sequel, [[Subnautica Below Zero]], was released in 2019.

title: nude
body:
Not wearing any clothing on the chest and crotch. Clothing on other body parts, such as [[hat]]s, [[thighhighs]], [[elbow gloves]], or [[jewelry]], may still be worn.

See [[completely nude]] for when a character isn't wearing any clothing at all (except for very minor accessories).

h4. Guidelines

* Clothing on the arms, legs, or head, such as [[elbow gloves]], [[thighhighs]], and [[hat]]s, may still be worn.
* Minor accessories, such has [[jewelry]], [[hair ornament]]s, [[glasses]], [[belt]]s, etc, may still be worn.
* "Naked" outfits - [[naked apron]], [[naked shirt]], [[naked towel]], etc - aren't considered [[nude]]. "Naked" substances - [[naked paint]], [[naked chocolate]], etc - are still considered [[nude]].
* Wearing [[bandaid on anus]], [[bandaids on nipples|nipples]], or [[bandaid on pussy|pussy]], [[maebari]], or [[pasties]] are still considered [[nude]].
* Naked characters covering their nudity ([[nude cover]]) are still considered [[nude]].
* Naked [[mermaid]]s, or other [[monster girl]]s who don't wear clothing from the waist down, are [[nude]], not [[topless female]].
* Don't use [[nude]] with the [[topless female]]/[[topless male]] tags, [[bottomless]], [[no bra]], [[no panties]], [[bare arms]], [[bare back]], [[bare shoulders]], [[midriff]], or other tags for partial nudity. The [[barefoot]] tag is still appropriate to use.

h4. See also

* [[completely nude]]
* [[Tag group:Nudity]]
* [[Tag group:Sexual attire]]

title: no_shirt
body:
Wearing everything but a [[shirt]]. That is, wearing a [[bra]] or [[bikini top only|bikini top]] with pants (or other bottoms), but without a shirt.

Don't use if the character is completely [[nude]], [[bottomless]], [[topless female]]/[[topless male]], [[no pants|pantsless]], or wearing [[underwear only]]. They should be wearing at least a bra (or something similar), and at least [[shorts]], [[pants]], or something similar.

h4. See also

* [[no bra]]
* [[no pants]]

title: soda_bottle
body:
A [[bottle]] that tapers into a thin neck, where [[soda]] is stored for future consumption. The bottle can either be made out of glass or plastic.

h4. See also
* [[Ramune]]

title: phonecard
body:
A small card, usually resembling a credit card, used to pay for telephone services. Used prominently but not exclusively to debit at [[payphone]]s such as post #3972756.
Some cards come decorated with various prints or characters for collecting purposes.

This tag to both the card itself, as well as refers to the design of such element ala [[dakimakura (medium)]].

Japanese name: テレカ (teleca / tereka) or telephone card.

h4. See also

* [[Phone Booth]]
* [[Payphone]]

title: bucket_hat
body:
A soft cotton [[hat]] with a wide and downward-sloping brim. Favored by fishermen.

If the character is using an actual bucket as a hat, use [[bucket on head]]. Do not confuse with [[pith helmet]], a hard downward-sloping cotton hat stereotypically associated with safaris.

title: douki-chan_(douki-chan)
body:
An unnamed character by [[Yomu (Sgt Epper)]], and the protagonist of [[Ganbare Douki-Chan]]. An [[office lady]] who has an unrequited crush on her co-worker [[Douki-kun (douki-chan)|]]. Unfortunately for her, her attempts to pursue her colleague are often sabotaged by other women, including her rival [[Kouhai-chan (douki-chan)|]] and [[Senpai-san (douki-chan)|]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] in a [[short ponytail]] and usually wears a blue [[dress shirt]] with a [[pencil skirt]], red underwear and [[see-through legwear|sheer]] [[brown pantyhose]].

title: janine_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Janine[/b], known as [b]Anzu[/b] (アンズ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon gsc|Gold and Silver]][/i].

[[Koga (pokemon)|]]'s [[father and daughter|daughter]] and a [[ninja]] Gym Leader, she uses Poison-type [[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]] out of respect for her father. She also likes to argue like him from time to time. Her signature Pokémon is [[Venomoth]].

She has [[purple hair]] in a [[wide ponytail]]. She wears a [[scarf]] and [[white socks|white]] [[tabi]].

h4. See also

* [[Soul Badge]]

h4. External links

* "Bulbapedia: Janine":[https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Janine]
* "Pixivpedia (JP): Anzu (Trainer)":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E3%82%A2%E3%83%B3%E3%82%BA(%E3%83%88%E3%83%AC%E3%83%BC%E3%83%8A%E3%83%BC)]

title: japanese_clothes
body:
Any variety of traditional Japanese clothing. This excludes modern Japanese fashion, such as [[lolita fashion]] and [[school uniform]]s like [[serafuku]] and [[gakuran]].
H4. Clothes 
[Expand=Clothing sets]
* !post #6471566:  [[ecchuu fundoshi]] [tn]| A [[fundoshi]] with a [[loincloth]].[/tn]
* !post #7062726:  [[jinbei_(clothes)|jinbei]]
* !post #7456212:  [[meiji schoolgirl uniform]] [tn]| Despite the name of the tag, it's not always a [[school uniform]].[/tn]
* !post #2729999:  [[mizu happi]] [tn]| A combination of a [[happi]] coat and [[fundoshi]] (underwear).[/tn]
* !post #7168082:  [[montsuki]] [tn]| A men's attire for special occasions (black being the most formal color among them). It must feature a mon (family emblem).[/tn]
* !post #3464471:  [[samue]] [tn]| A simple outfit originally worn by Japanese Zen Buddhist for manual work.[/tn]
* !post #7099410:  [[sokutai]] [tn]| Formal court clothing.[/tn]
* !post #4967906:  [[shosei]] [tn]| A houseboy (but features a particular style of clothing).[/tn]
* !post #6807184: [[karate gi]]
[/Expand]
[Expand=Kimono & obi]

title: wallet
body:
A small flat case that can hold small personal items such as paper currency, credit cards, identification documents, photographs, commuter passes, business cards, and other paper or laminated cards.

h5. Types

* Hakoseko (筥迫): Traditional Japanese wallet for a traditional Japanese [[bride]] in her wedding or for a child's [[Shichi-go-san]] ceremony.
* [[Clutch purse]]

h4. See also

* [[Coin purse]]

title: handbag
body:
A [[bag]] used for carrying money and small personal items or accessories. The outside is often decorated.

h4. See also

* [[coin purse]]
* [[satchel]]
* [[shoulder bag]]
* [[wallet]]
* [[clutch purse]]

title: shishiro_botan_(jirai_kei)
body:
The 6th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Shishiro Botan]].

It is a [[jirai kei]]-themed outfit that consists of a [[red shirt|red]] or [[pink shirt]] with a black [[detached collar]] with a [[black bowtie]], [[center frills]], [[shoulder cutout]]s and [[cross-laced sleeves]] or a [[sleeveless shirt]] with the same colors and design, a [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[black skirt|black]] or [[white skirt|white]] [[high-waist skirt|high-waist]] [[suspender skirt|suspender]] [[miniskirt]] with [[black thighhighs]] held with [[legwear garter]]s attached to [[thigh strap]]s and [[black boots|black]] [[lace-up boots]].

She has 3 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume:

* [[long hair|Long]] [[wavy hair]] in a [[two side up]] held with [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon]]s with multiple [[x hair ornament]]s
* The same long wavy hair with [[long sidelocks]]
* [[Medium hair]] tied into a pair of [[twintails]] with regular [[sidelocks]]

h4. Appearance

* !post #8567693: Profile

title: shishiro_botan_(casual)
body:
The 4th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Shishiro Botan]].

It consists of a [[black choker]] with a [[necklace]], a [[loose shirt|loose]] [[white shirt|white]] [[t-shirt]] which exposes [[single bare shoulder|her left shoulder]] and [[bra strap]] (although she has an option to toggle it off, giving the impression that she is wearing [[no bra]]), a [[black jacket|black]] [[hooded jacket]] with [[raglan sleeves]], [[torn shorts|torn]] [[black shorts|black]] [[denim shorts]], a [[single sock|single]] [[grey socks|grey]] [[single loose sock|loose]] [[loose socks|sock]] and dark grey [[high tops]].

For her 3rd anniversary on December 2023 she got an optional [[black capelet|black]] [[fur-trimmed capelet]] and a [[crown]] with a small [[SSRB (shishiro botan)|]] stuck on it.

She has 3 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] with this costume:

* [[Long hair]] tied into [[low twintails]] with a [[long hair between eyes|long strand between her eyes]]
* Long [[messy hair]] also reaching between her eyes
* [[Medium hair]] tied into [[twintails]] with a [[black bow|black]] [[hair bow]] and [[long bangs|long]] [[asymmetrical bangs]] [[hair over one eye|covering her left eye]]

h4. Appearance

* !asset #25273136: Profile
* !post #8290602: Merchandise (1)
* !post #5655386: Merchandise (2)

title: pirassununga_51
body: Pirassununga 51 is a well-known brand of cachaça, a Brazilian distilled spirit made from sugarcane juice. It is one of the most widely consumed cachaças in Brazil and abroad. Due to its strong association with Brazilian culture, it is frequently used in caipirinhas and other cocktails and used as reference for arts featuring Cachaça bottles. The brand is recognizable by its white label with red and gold accents, featuring the number "51" prominently.

title: xiao_guan_(headdress)
body:
Xiao guan (lit. small guan)  is an informal guan (Chinese headwear for men) which covers the topknot of hair and secured with either [[hair stick]] or [[chin strap]]. It come in various shapes, as long as it is the size fitting to that of a topknot.

Xiao guan that resemble crowns are also called shufa guan, and in Korean, sangtugwan.

h4.See also

* [[fengguan|feng guan]]
* [[mian guan]]
* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

h4.External links

* "A list of Guan, Jin, and other headwear": https://torguqin.wordpress.com/hanfu/hanfu-history/list/

title: ouran_high_school_host_club
body:
A [[bishounen]] / [[yaoi|boy's love]] parody manga series, running from 2002 to 2010 by an author under the pen name Bisco Hatori. A very popular anime adaption aired in 2006, and introduced many westerners to shoujo manga and partially the BL genre. 

h4. Characters

title: espresso_cookie
body:
[[Cookie Run: Kingdom]] playable character of the Magic class. He debuted on January 21st 2021. 

Hailing from the Crème Republic, Espresso Cookie is a pioneer and proponent of Coffee Magic, researching and experimenting through many sleepless nights to constantly refine his craft. This [[wizard]] occasionally teaches classes on Coffee Magic at the Parfaedia Institute. A serious, intellectual and confident perfectionist with workaholic tendencies and a heart of gold.

He has [[dark-skinned male|dark skin]], [[brown eyes]] with [[slit pupils]] and [[brown hair|brown]]/[[black hair|black]] [[short hair]] with [[hair over one eye]] and [[white hair|white]] [[streaked hair]]. He wears [[round eyewear|round]] [[glasses]].

His outfit is commonly agreed to be consisted of a [[black robe]], [[black cape]], [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[pink necktie]] and [[black footwear]], though there are variations depending on each artist’s interpretation. 

His English VA is [[Zach Aguilar]].

title: lucina_(summer)_(fire_emblem)
body:
Tag used for [[Lucina (Fire Emblem)|]] from [[Fire Emblem]] specifically when dressed in her swimsuit from the [[Fire Emblem Heroes]] 2020 "Summer Passing":[https://feheroes.fandom.com/wiki/Summer_Passing_(Focus)] banner.

In-game, she shows up with her mask, and presents herself as [[Marth (Fire Emblem Awakening)|Masked Marth]], so the corresponding tag should be added.
Extremely likely to see her along with [[Mia (Summer) (Fire Emblem)|Summer Mia]], the main character of the Duo Unit she's part of - Summer Lucina isn't her own unit in-game.

Note that it's possible (especially for older artwork), to depict Lucina in a swimsuit without it being the one described above, in which case this tag should not be used.

title: chrom_(fire_emblem)
body:
Main protagonist of [[Fire Emblem]] [[Fire Emblem Awakening|Awakening]]. The prince of the Halidom of Ylisse and a descendent of [[marth (fire emblem)|Marth]] himself, Chrom is the leader of a militia force known as the Shepherds. He is the middle sibling of three: [[Emmeryn (Fire Emblem)|Emmeryn]], his elder sister, is the Exalt of Ylisse, and [[Lissa (Fire Emblem)|Lissa]] is his younger sister.

[spoiler][[Lucina (Fire Emblem)|Lucina]] is revealed to be his own daughter from the future.[/spoiler]

CV: [[Sugita Tomokazu]] (JP), [[Matthew Mercer]] (EN)

title: blaze_the_cat
body:
Character from the [[sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog]] series. She's a purple anthropomorphic [[cat girl]], who made her debut in the 2005 release of [[Sonic Rush]]. She was designed by Akinori Nishiyama, and since then has been a reoccurring character. 

Blaze is [[sonic the hedgehog|Sonic]] from an alternate dimension, or a friend of [[silver the hedgehog|Silver]] from an alternate future depending on the game you go off of. She's the guardian of the Sol Emeralds and has pyrokinetic abilities.

She has been voiced by Erica Schroeder, [[Laura Bailey]], and [[Erica Lindbeck]].

title: necrass_(arknights)
body:
A playable Caster Operator in [[Arknights]].

Leader of the armed Taran separatist movement "Dublinn", first appearing in Chapter 9 of the main story. One of the characters of the side-story [i]What the Firelight Casts[/i], alongside her sister [[Reed (arknights)|]].

Like her sister, she possesses the ability to manipulate life, but unlike Reed, hers manifests as something akin to necromancy.

title: ar-15
body:
The [B][[AR-15]][/b] is an American semi-automatic [[rifle]] designed in 1956 by Eugene Stoner and L. James Sullivan, based on the [[AR-10]]. AR stands for [b]ArmaLite[/b], its original manufacturer. The early design feature a top-mounted charging handle inside the carry handle. Its selective fire variant was eventually adopted by the U.S. military as the M16. 

Predominantly available in .223/5.56mm caliber, the rifle enjoys a huge popularity for its accuracy, and controllable recoil, as well as modular and customizable design despite surrounding controversies. Therefore various companies manufacture and market such rifles. 

* Any non-military issue rifle of this design is properly labelled AR-15 regardless of specific subvariant. Or for any AR-15-style rifles of less-known, unspecified model.
* Usage context is for non-military, civilian setting. Because further artistic details of fire selector can be rendered invisible or insignificant most of the time.
* This tag should not be used altogether to refer several better-known, AR-based military-grade rifles such as the [[M16]], [[Colt Commando]], [[M4 Carbine]], or [[h&k hk416|HK416]].

h4.See also
* [[Colt 9mm SMG]]
* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[ST AR-15 (Girls' Frontline)]]

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: AR-15-style rifle":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AR-15–style_rifle

title: them's_fightin'_herds
body:
Fighting game focused on cartoon hooved animals developed by Mane6 and published by Modus Games. Released in 2020.

Originally developed as the [[My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic]] fan game "Fighting is Magic" before receiving a cease and desist from Hasbro due to attention drawn to the early build of the game at EVO. Creator of FiM [[Lauren Faust]] offered to create original character designs for the game, and thus it was spun into its own IP.

The game runs on the Z-Engine, the engine designed by the team behind [[Skullgirls]].

The game ceased development in 2024 after the release of its final two DLC characters.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Them's Fightin' Herds":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Them's_Fightin'_Herds

title: zeta_gundam
body:
[b][i]Zeta Gundam[/i][/b] is the [[mecha]] anime 1985 TV sequel to [[Mobile Suit Gundam]]. It was created by largely the same creative staff as is predecessor, but veteran designer [[Ookawara Kunio]] was assisted in mechanical designs by newcomers [[Nagano Mamoru]] and [[Fujita Kazumi]]. It also had character designs by [[Kitazume Hiroyuki]] and [[Yasuhiko Yoshikazu]]. 

[i]Zeta Gundam[/i] followed in the footsteps of [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] (1982) by including a large number of transforming [[mobile_suit|MS]] [[robot]]s, a first for a [[Gundam]] show.

It is set in the year [b]Universal Century 0087[/b], eight years after the original series. It follows the story of [[Kamille Bidan]], designer and pilot of the [[Zeta Gundam (Mobile Suit)|MSZ-006 Zeta Gundam]], in an interplanetary conflict known as "The Gryps War", between the oppresive and brutal [[titans_(gundam)|Earth Federation Titans]] against the alliance of the valiant [[AEUG]] and the Karaba resistance organization.

The story of the series continues directly into [[Gundam ZZ]].

To this day is considered by many anime critics as the most influential and best Universal Century Gundam series ever made."(1)":https://www.fandomspot.com/best-gundam-anime/ "(2)":https://screenrant.com/best-gundam-anime-of-all-time/

title: solo:_a_star_wars_story
body:
[b]Solo: A Star Wars Story[/b] is a 2018 American space Western film centering on the [[Star Wars]] character [[Han Solo]]. Directed by Ron Howard, produced by Lucasfilm, and distributed by Walt Disney Studios Motion Pictures, it is the second Star Wars anthology film, following [[Rogue One: A Star Wars Story]] (2016). 

Alden Ehrenreich stars as Solo, with Woody Harrelson, Emilia Clarke, Donald Glover, Thandiwe Newton, Phoebe Waller-Bridge, Joonas Suotamo, and Paul Bettany.

The film tells the origin story of Han Solo and [[Chewbacca]], who join a heist within the criminal underworld ten years prior to the events of [[Star Wars: A New Hope]] (1977).

title: sprunki
body:
Sprunki is a horror [[Incredibox]] mod that originated from the Scratch website made by NyankoBfLol, later officially ported to Incredimake before it got taken down.

[spoilers]The gameplay is the same as Incredibox as it is a mod. You drag one of the 20 character icons on the bottom of the screen onto one of the 7 empty polos. However, once you drag the Black top-hat icon, the game will go into horror mode after a temporary black screen, with all the characters being either injured, insane, or traumatized.
There is also a reset button on the top right corner of the screen that resets the characters.[/spoilers] 


* !asset #24086729

h4. See also 

* [[Incredibox]]

title: camilla_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Camilla[/b] (カミラ Kamira) is a playable character in [i][[Fire Emblem Fates]][/i].

The eldest princess of the Nohrian royal family, Camilla carries herself with maturity and elegance on the onset but treats her family with unrivalled care and affection. She is ruthless on the battlefield, destroying her enemies with wild abandon. Along with the other royal siblings, she was subject to the family's "concubine wars" at a young age. She bathes the longest out of anyone in the army, and her birthday is on November 30th.

Camilla has [[very long hair|very]] [[long hair|long]], [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[purple hair]] with [[hair over one eye|one bang covering her left eye]], [[purple eyes]], full [[lips]], [[large breasts]], and well-shaped [[thighs]]. She dons [[black armor|black]] [[armor]] shaped like a [[bodice]] that exposes her [[cleavage]] and [[groin]], also showing off her [[black panties|black]] [[panties]] and leaving her [[ass]] visible (post #2147528 for an official example). She also wears [[armored boots|armored]] [[black footwear|black]] [[thigh boots|thigh-length]] [[high heel boots|high-heel]] [[boots]] and a [[tiara]]. Camilla is often portrayed riding her [[undead]] [[wyvern]] and wielding a [[battle axe]].

She is voiced by [[Sawashiro Miyuki]] in Japanese. "Paula Tiso":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paula_Tiso voices her in English [i][[Fire Emblem Fates|Fates]][/i], and "Misty Lee":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Misty_Lee voices her in English [[Fire Emblem Heroes]] and [[Fire Emblem Warriors]].

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Revenant Knight (Malig Knight)

h4. Appearance

title: sandevistan
body:
A cyberware implant in [i][[Cyberpunk (series)|]][/i].

Its function is to give the user increased reflexes for higher reaction times. Gameplay-wise, it appears to the player as [[slow motion|slowing down time]]. In [i][[Cyberpunk Edgerunners]][/i], its use is shown through [[afterimage]]s of the user.

title: vinsmoke_reiju
body:
[[One Piece]] character. The eldest sister of the Vinsmoke family and [[Sanji (one piece)|]]'s older sister. She is the princess of the Germa kingdom and served as one of the commanders of the Germa 66 army.

Like the rest of her family, she is genetically-modified to become a super-soldier, as such she possesses superhuman strength in addition of her natural ability to create and absorb poison.

title: king_kong
body:
A giant [[ape]] monster who first appeared in the 1933 film King Kong. He has appeared in several media since, including films, comics, cartoons, video games, as well as becoming part of the [[MonsterVerse]], having crossovers with [[Godzilla]].

h4. See also
* [[Kong (Monsterverse)]]

title: korean_people's_army
body: The official armed forces of [[North Korea]].

title: jet_jaguar
body:
A giant [[robot]] from [[Godzilla (series)|]] series. First appeared in [i]Godzilla vs. Megalon[/i]

Jet Jaguar was initially built as a human-sized robot, but after being kidnapped by the Sepia people, Jet Jaguar (somehow) became self-aware and gained an ability to dramatically increase his size, to which he used this new ability to fight any hostile kaiju and protect humanity.

Jet Jaguar's characteristic, particularly its color scheme, is a rather obvious spoof to the rival [[Ultra Series]].

h4. See also

* [[Jet Jaguar (Singular Point)]]

title: mahou_shoujo_madoka_magica
body:
[b]Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica[/b], also known as [b]Puella Magi Madoka Magica[/b], is a multimedia franchise focusing on a world in which young girls can make a contract with [[Kyubey]] to become [[Magical Girl]]s - in return, becoming duty-bound to fight [[Witch (madoka magica)|Witches]]. Known for its surprisingly dark tone.

h4. List of works

h5. Mainline

* [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica (anime)]]
** [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Movie 1 & 2]]
** [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Manga]]
** [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Novel]] 
* [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica: Hangyaku no Monogatari]]
* [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica: Walpurgis no Kaiten]]

h6. Games
* [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Mobage]]
* [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Portable]]
* [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Plus]]
* [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Online]]

h6. Concepts
* [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica: Concept Movie]]

h5. Spin-offs

* [[Mahou Shoujo Tart Magica]]
* [[Mahou Shoujo Suzune Magica]]
* [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]]
* [[Null Mahou Shoujo]]
* [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Magia Exedra]]

h5. Others
* Manga Time Kirara Magica (pool #19682)

title: null_mahou_shoujo
body:
A [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]] light novel. It is written by Kusano Gengen, and illustrated by [[Haruhana Aya]]. Its publication began in the Puella Magi Madoka Magica 10th Anniversary Book on June 25, 2021.

Focuses on Kiriha Kosane, a 24 year old woman who couldn't have become a Magical Girl, as she lacks both a brain and a soul.

h4. Characters
* [[Kiriha Kosane]]
* [[Kiriha Eruna]]
* [[Kyubey]]

h4. See also
* "Puella Magi Wiki - Null Magical Girl":[https://wiki.puella-magi.net/Null_Magical_Girl]

title: mahou_shoujo_madoka_magica:_walpurgis_no_kaiten
body:
An upcoming movie in the [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]] series. First announced in April 2021, as a part of the series' tenth anniversary celebrations, and is set to release in winter 2025. Its English title is Walpurgisnacht:Rising.

title: mahou_shoujo_madoka_magica_plus
body:
A now-defunct [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]] mobile game, released on November 19th, 2012, to replace [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Mobage]].

It did not introduce any new characters, though it did feature a high amount of costumes for the series' original cast and a collaboration with [[Nisekoi]].

It featured a plethora of cards with costumes for the anime's cast, and later down the line, [[Momoe Nagisa]] as well.

h4. See also:
* "Mobage.Booru - a booru dedicated to gacha cards from the game":[https://mobage.booru.org/index.php]
* "Wayback Machine - an archived version of the game's now-defunct website":[https://web.archive.org/web/20141215000000*/https://mmp-social.com]
* "Mobcast page":[http://lp.mobcast.jp/game/1149/]

title: mahou_shoujo_madoka_magica_mobage
body:
A now-defunct [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]] mobile game, released on September 16th, 2011. It ended service in 2012.

Not to be confused with [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Plus]], a later game which also used the Mobage portal, whose dedicated booru is named simply "''mobage''":[https://mobage.booru.org/index.php].

It featured four new characters:
* [[claire (madoka magica)|Claire]]
* [[elise_(madoka_magica_mobage)|Elise]]
* [[hiyori (madoka magica)|Hiyori]]
* [[komachi_(madoka_magica_mobage)|Komachi]]

h4. See also:
* "Puella Magi Wiki - Puella Magi Madoka Magica Mobage":[https://wiki.puella-magi.net/Madoka_Magica_Mobage]

title: mahou_shoujo_kazumi_magica
body:
Manga series written by Hiramatsu Masaki and illustrated by [[Tensugi Takashi]], serialized in Manga Time Kirara Forward. Released from 2011 to 2012.
The authors professed that it's a spin-off of [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]].

Follows the story of Kazumi, who found herself amnesiac after she was kidnapped.

h4.Characters

h6. Members of "Pleiades Saints" (Pleiades [i]Seidan[/i])

* [[Misaki Umika]]

* [[Usagi Satomi]]
* [[Kanna Nico]]
* [[Asami Saki]]

h6. Other characters

* [[Anri Airi]]
* [[Asuka Yuuri]]

title: mermaid_melody_pichi_pichi_pitch
body:
Manga series written by Yokote Michiko and illustrated by Pink Hanamori. Originally serialized in Kodansha's [i]Nakayoshi[/i] from 2002 to 2005, later collected in 7 volumes. It was adapted into an anime series with two seasons: the 52-episode [i]Mermaid Melody Pichi Pichi Pitch[/i] (2003-2004) and the 39-episode [i]Mermaid Melody Pichi Pichi Pitch Pure[/i] (2004).

body:

title: harlequin
body:
Traditionally, a harlequin is a [[mask]]ed [[bald]] pantomime fool who wields a [[wooden sword]] while wearing variegated [[tights]] and brightly colored [[checkered]] clothes.

For tagging purposes, the [[costume]] is all that's needed to qualify here.

For the [[Warhammer 40K]] faction use "[[harlequin_(warhammer)]]

h4. See also

* [[clown]]
* [[jester]]

title: the_matrix
body:
[[Science fiction]] [[cyberpunk]] franchise, comprised of movies, [[video game]]s, and other media.

[spoilers]Many film experts have found similarities between the concept of simulated reality of the franchise to that of an 80s anime called [[Megazone 23]], however the creators of Matrix have constantly denied any influence from it.[/spoilers]

h4. Characters

* [[Neo (the matrix)|]]
* [[Trinity]]
* [[Morpheus (the matrix)|]]
* [[Agent Smith]]
* [[The Twins (the matrix)|]]
* [[Sentinel (the matrix)|]]s

H4. Media that inspired The Matrix

* [[Akira (manga)|AKIRA]]
* [[BLAME!]]
* [[Juubei Ninpuuchou]]
* [[Ghost In The Shell]]

h4. See also

* [[Digital Rain]]
* [[Bullet Time]]

title: hijirisawa_shonosuke
body:
An unnamed extra character from [i][[Osomatsu-kun]][/i]. His first appearance was as a robber that [[matsuno_osomatsu|Osomatsu]] and [[matsuno_choromatsu|Choromatsu]] encountered. In [i][[Osomatsu-san]][/i], he appears as a recurring minor character and gains the name Hijirisawa Shonosuke. He also appears to have gained 17 identical siblings.

He is a short, bald man with a [[unibrow]], [[buck teeth]], and thin, long mustache.
other_names: ヒジリサワ↓ショウノスケ↑ダー!!

title: chimera_(honkai:_star_rail)
body: Small, four legged creatures from Amphoreus. Their horns, color, and wings can vary.

title: holi_festival
body:
A [[spring (season)|spring festival]] known as the "Festival of Colors", originating as a Hindu religious festival in [[India]] and [[Nepal]] which has since become popular with people of other communities, especially overseas Hindus. 

The epithet "Festival of Colors" comes from the dousing of colored water and powder normally associated with the Holi festivities.

title: superhuman_samurai_syber-squad
body:
A 1994 live action series by DiC Entertainment using footage from the tokusatsu series [i][[Denkou Choujin Gridman]][/i]. The series ran from 1994 to 1995.

Elements of the series would later be used in [i][[SSSS.Gridman]][/i].

h4. See also

title: note
body:
Use when information of any sort (typically written, may involve pictures) is being conveyed through a single sheet of [[paper]], which may or may not have been ripped out of a [[notebook]] or similar.

Often stuck on walls with [[tape]] or [[nail (hardware)|nail]]s, sometimes just left on surfaces like [[bed]]s or [[table]]s.

For musical notation, use [[musical note]] instead.

title: set500_(mcdonald's)
body:
A character introduced by [[McDonald's]] Japan to advertise its medium-sized low cost combo meals for 500 yen.

Its design consists of a [[robot girl]] with [[white hair]], [[black eyes]] and [[mechanical arms]] and [[mechanical legs|legs]] with no joints, wearing a [[red hairband]] with [[fake antennae]], a white [[skirt set]] composed of a [[white shirt]] with a [[screen]] and a [[white skirt]], [[red gloves]], [[red shoes|shoes]] and a pair of [[sphere earrings]].

Is often accompanied by a smaller robot with a single antenna and a [[wheel]].

title: mystic_knights_of_tir_na_nog
body: Western live-action series created by Saban Entertainment (creators of [[Power Rangers]]), Renaissance-Atlantic Films (co-creators of PR), and Sharpmist, Ltd. (based at Ardmore Studios), and produced in Ireland. A fantasy-adventure series loosely based on [[Irish mythology]], derived from Tír na nÓg, one of the Otherworlds of Irish mythology. One of the rare attempts at Western [[tokusatsu]] during the 90s, alongside DIC's [[Tattooed Teenage Alien Fighters from Beverly Hills]].

title: ken_masters
body:
[b]Ken Masters[/b] is a video game character created by [[Capcom]]. He is one of the main characters from the [[Street Fighter]] series of fighting games alongside [[Ryu (street fighter)|]]. 

Ken was initially created as a [[palette swap]] for [[player 2]] in the first Street Fighter title and thus used an identical moveset to that of Ryu's in early installments, though Capcom later on decided to make the two distinct by making Ken being more specialized on [[Shouryuuken]] in parallel with Ryu's [[Hadouken]].

Ken has a wife, [[Eliza Masters|Eliza]] and a son, [[Mel Masters|Mel]].

title: cammy_white
body:
[b]Cammy White[/b] is a character in the [[Street Fighter]] series. Her [i]nom de guerre[/i] is the codename [b]Killer Bee[/b] (christened in [[Street Fighter Zero (series)|Street Fighter Zero 3]] and kept for herself afterwards). She first appeared in the fighting game [[Street Fighter II (series)|Super Street Fighter II]] (1993) as one of the titular "New Challengers," the four new characters introduced in that title. She is the second female character in the Street Fighter series, following [[Chun-Li]]. Cammy is a female clone of [[M. Bison]], originally serving within his organization Shadaloo as both Bison's potential replacement body should his original body fail, and, until then, the leader of the [[Shadaloo dolls|"Dolls"]] - Bison's personal unit of brainwashed bodyguards and underlings. She later went rogue after her encounter with [[Dhalsim]] nullified Bison's Psycho Powered mind control. As of [[Street Fighter II (series)|]] onward to the present in [[Street Fighter 6]], she serves as a member of Delta Red, a British special forces unit with connections to MI6. She has made it her personal mission to locate, rescue, and rehabilitate the Dolls. She collaborates closely with most of the other World Warriors on her assignments, notably [[Chun-Li]]. Trained extensively in close-quarters combat, Cammy likes to strike with quick, sharp attacks like a stinging bee (hence her codename) and use takedowns to immobilize and cripple her foes. Her signature techniques include the [i]Spiral Arrow[/i] and [i]Cannon Spike/Strike[/i] - both flying kick attacks that send Cammy lunging feet first at sharp angles, whether straight forward, up into the sky, or down from the air - as well as the [i]Hooligan Combination[/i], where she hurls herself into close quarters to either grapple the opponent to the ground or strike from odd angles. h4. Appearance * !post #939647: [[Street Fighter II (series)|]]
"Delta Red" (original) * !post #1291102: [[Street Fighter Zero (series)|]]
"Killer Bee" * !post #386341: [[Street Fighter IV (series)|]] * !post #2041295: [[Street Fighter V]] * !post #6369826: [[Street Fighter 6]] She has 2 well known outfits/appearances depending on the Street Fighter timeline, although both have her wearing some manner of [[highleg leotard]] and red gauntlet-like gloves, sporting long [[blonde hair|blonde]] [[twin braids]], and showing off a long [[scar]] on her left cheek. Her original "Delta Red" appearance, worn in every instance outside her Alpha/Zero appearances prior to Street Fighter 6, has her in a green [[highleg leotard]] with a small triangle badge above her right breast and a red [[beret]]. [[Street Fighter V]] adds a [[chest harness]] and a [[thigh holster]] on her right leg, but loses the green patches of [[bodypaint]] originally seen on her legs. The bodypaint does make a return in Street Fighter 6 as part of her Street Fighter V form/"younger self" alternate skin. Her appearance in [[Fortnite]] as a Gaming Legends outfit skin adds [[pantyhose]] with a [[camouflage]] pattern to her Street Fighter V outfit. In her Alpha/Zero "Killer Bee" appearance, which takes place during the time she was a member of M. Bison's Dolls, she instead wears a light blue long-sleeved [[ribbed leotard|ribbed]] [[highleg leotard]] with a matching color [[garrison cap]] and a small yellow necktie with a black armband on her left arm. Like in her original form, she has bodypaint patches on her legs, except they are blue to match her leotard and somewhat [[lightning bolt symbol|lightning bolt]]-shaped. In [[Street Fighter 6]], Cammy has [[short hair|cut her hair short]], and she now sports a [[blue jacket|blue]] [[cropped jacket|bolero]] with [[Union Jack]] print, [[black sports bra]] and black [[yoga pants]]. h5. Street Fighter V alternate costumes * [[Story Mode Cammy]] * [[Battle Outfit Cammy]] * [[Capcom Pro Tour Cammy]] * Swimsuit (August 2016) * [[Halloween Cammy]] * [[School Uniform Cammy]] * Nostalgia (Street Fighter IV Complete Alternate / 1; September 2017) * [[Dolls Cammy]] (Street Fighter Zero) * [[Holiday Cammy]] * Cannon Spike ([[Gunspike]]; June 2018) * [[Track Suit Cammy]] * [[Killer Bee Cammy]] (Street Fighter Zero) h5. Alternate costumes elsewhere * [[Final Fight Streetwise]]: [[Streetwise Cammy]] * [[Street Fighter IV (series)|]]: [[M. Bison (cosplay)|]] cosplay (Street Fighter IV Super Complete Alternate / 2) * [[Power Rangers: Battle for the Grid]]: [[Stinging Crane Ranger]] * [[Fortnite]]: [[Fortnite Cammy]] h4. See also * [[Cammy stretch (meme)]] h4. External links * Street Fighter V: "Cammy (Costumes)":https://game.capcom.com/cfn/sfv/character/cammy/costume?lang=en

title: chun-li
body:
[b]Chun-Li[/b] (Traditional: 春麗. Simplified: 春丽) is a character in the [[Street Fighter]] series by [[Capcom]]. She is the first female playable character to appear in a 1-on-1 fighting game.

Introduced in [[Street Fighter II (series)|]], Chun-Li was the youngest member of the roster and only female character in the game, the self-proclaimed "strongest woman in the world," and while not as physically powerful as the other characters, she was by far the quickest. Her most famous attack is the [i]Hyakuretsukyaku[/i] ("Hundred Crack Legs", alternately known as "Lightning Legs"), where she repeatedly kicks her opponent from a tilted standing position with incredible speed.

In the Street Fighter series, Chun-Li was an Interpol investigator from [[China]] who had been searching for clues to the recent death of her father. Getting into a friendly spar with an old teacher of hers and friend of her father, [[Gen (street fighter)|]], he gives her a lead into who may have killed her father—the mysterious crime syndicate Shadaloo and its tyrannical leader [[M. Bison]]. After an encounter where M. Bison confirms he slew her father, a tearful Chun-Li swore vengeance and made it her life's mission to destroy Shadaloo and bring M. Bison to justice. She collaborated closely with [[Guile]], [[Cammy White]], [[Ryu (Street Fighter)|]], and the other World Warriors throughout the journey.

After M. Bison's supposedly final death during [[Street Fighter V]], her mission complete, Chun-Li retired from Interpol and opened an orphanage to live a quieter life. The most famous of her young wards - practically her adopted daughter - is [[Li-Fen]].

Chun-Li is one of Capcom's most popular characters and one of the most important females in video game history, appearing in numerous cross-overs and promotions. Her oldest and arguably greatest cross-company rival is [[SNK]]'s [[Fatal Fury]]'s [[Shiranui Mai|Mai Shiranui]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #4060584: [[Street Fighter II (series)|]]
* !post #1291111: [[Street Fighter Zero (series)|]]
* !post #487373: [[Street Fighter III (series)|]]
* !post #309867: [[Street Fighter IV (series)|]]
* !post #5402417: [[Street Fighter 6]]
* !post #4290021: Athlete Chun-Li ([[Street Fighter: Duel]])


Her first design was based on another character from Capcom called [[Tong Pooh]].

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair|brown]] or [[black hair]] almost always done up in a [[double bun]].

Standard costume consists of a [[blue dress|blue]] [[china dress]] with [[puffy short sleeves]] and a white [[sash]], two high [[side slit]]s forming a [[pelvic curtain]], [[brown pantyhose]], [[cross-laced footwear|cross-laced]] [[white footwear|white]] [[boots]], [[spiked bracelet]]s, and [[hair pulled back]] in [[double bun|buns]] under white [[bun cover]]s. She usually wears [[earrings]].

In [[Street Fighter Zero (series)|]], she wears a blue, sleeveless [[unitard]] and vest with sneakers and studded bracelets. [[Street Fighter IV (series)|]] & [[Street Fighter V]] introduced skimpier [[official alternate costume]]s, such as her [[backless dress]]; while [[Street Fighter 6]] gave her a [[multicolored dress|white/blue qipao]] & [[blue leggings]].

h4. Known moves

* [[Hyakuretsukyaku]] (百裂脚)
** Senretsukyaku
** Hou Yoku Sen (鳳翼扇)
** Hosenka
* [[Kikouken]] (続気拳)
** Kikoushou (続気掌)
* [[Spinning Bird Kick]] (回鳥脚)
* Hazanshu

h4. See also

* [[Blue Phoenix Ranger]]

* [[Akiman pose]]

title: hirose_koichi
body: A supporting character from Parts 4 and 5 of [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. His [[Stand (jojo)|]] is [[Echoes (stand)|]] and comes in three forms. His height is stated to be 157 cm but is drawn much shorter.

title: let's_kill_da_ho!
body:
[i]"Okay master, let's kill da ho! Beech!!"[/i]

A [[meme]] from [[Diamond wa Kudakenai]] originated from the quote of [[Echoes (stand)|]] [[Echoes ACT3|ACT 3]] to his master [[Hirose Koichi]], after the nurse declined the request to visit [[Kishibe Rohan]] and mocking his stature, just before using his power to knock her out and force their way in.

This quote is often associated with [[Amano Pikamee]] and [[Hikasa Tomoshika]] from [[VOMS]] due to a popular clip involving Tomoshika repeatedly said "Let's kill da ho!" without even knowing its actual meaning.

title: torture_dance
body:
A [[dancing|dance]] performed by [[Guido Mista]], [[Narancia Ghirga]], and [[Pannacotta Fugo]] in the [[vento_aureo|fifth part]] of [[Jojo no Kimyou na Bouken|]]. 

While the manga only featured the dance in four panels, it proved popular with the fans that it was expanded in the video games. Furthermore, in the anime adaptation, a song titled [i]Canzoni Preferite[/i] (Favorite Songs), arranged by Kanno Yuugo and sung by Hasegawa Daisuke, was used when this scene was vastly expanded upon. The adaptation turned what is a four-panel gag into a roughly minute-long music video, complete with psychedelic imagery and effects.

title: california_king_bed
body:
A [[stand (jojo)|]] in [[JoJolion]].

Namesake is "California King Bed" by Barbadian singer-songwriter Rihanna from her fifth studio album [i]Loud[/i], released on 12 November 2010, also as a single on 13 May 2011.

title: paper_moon_king
body:
A [[stand (jojo)|]] in [[JoJolion]].

A likely namesake is the 1933 song "It's Only a Paper Moon", music by Harold Arlen with lyrics by Yip Harburg and Billy Rose. It was covered by a number of artists, including Nat King Cole.

title: sheer_heart_attack
body:
An attack used by [[Kira Yoshikage]]'s [[Stand (jojo)|]] [[Killer Queen]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]].  It is a heat seeking, mobile bomb that will relentlessly pursue its target, destroying anything that gets in its way. It can operate far away from Kira and is nigh-indestructible.

Namesake is the [[Queen (band)|]] album [i]Sheer Heart Attack[/i].

h4. Example
* !post #4900301
other_names: シアーハートアタック

title: red_stone_of_aja
body:
Distinctive red gem from Part 2 of [[Jojo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Sought after by the Pillar Men, as it is key in their quest for perfection. Often seen as a [[necklace]] on [[Lisa Lisa]].

Given Hirohiko Araki's fondness for musical references, it is not unlikely that the object might be named for either the album [i]Aja[/i], Steely Dan's sixth, released on 23 September 1977, and the song "Aja" on said album.

title: joestar_birthmark
body: A signature star-shaped birthmark found near the necks of the Joestar bloodline's members, the protagonists of [[Jojo no Kimyou na Bouken|]].

title: crazy_diamond_no_akuryouteki_shitsuren
body: [i]Crazy Diamond's Demonic Heartbreak[/i] is an official spinoff of [[Jojo no Kimyou na Bouken]] starring [[Hol Horse]] ten years after the events of [[Stardust Crusaders]] and before [[Diamond wa Kudakenai]].
