title: china_dress
body:
A form-fitting, Chinese [[dress]] that has [[side slit]]s up (usually) both legs and a [[mandarin collar]]. 

The traditional China dress, more properly called a [i]cheongsam[/i] (Cantonese) or [i]qipao[/i] (Mandarin), was introduced in Qing-era China in the 1600s but did not evolve into its current form until the early 20th century. There are many styles, but it typically is a long, form-fitting dress with a [[mandarin collar]], an asymmetric left-over-right opening, high-to-medium [[side slit]]s, and embellished with Chinese [[pankou|frog fasteners]] on the lapel and the collar. It may have any variety of sleeves. 

In anime they are often stylized to be more revealing than the traditional dress, being either very short, or having very long [[side slit]]s with a [[pelvic curtain]] that barely covers anything, or having [[cleavage cutout|cleavage]] or [[back cutout]]s.

Don't use this tag for qipao-styled clothes that aren't dresses, such as shirts or vests. Use [[Chinese clothes]] instead. For example, [[Hong Meiling]]'s default outfit is not a dress.

There are various types of neckline in qipao. The most common type is the [b][[shanghai neckline|Shanghai]][/b]-style neckline, which has an asymmetrical closure with frogs leading diagonally up to the collar. The [b]Beijing[/b]-style collar is a simpler symmetrical design, with a frog closure directly beneath the collar. The [b]Jiangnan[/b] style is similar to the Beijing style, but features a [[clothing cutout|hole]] right underneath the collar. 
H4. Examples of each neckline
* !post #6694692: [[Shanghai neckline]]
* !post #4779076: Beijing neckline
* !post #6709972: Jiangnan neckline

h4. Examples

* !post #8066966: A more traditional version, with slits up to the knees and a looser fit.
* !post #5767135: Modern qipao.
* !post #3903700: Short qipao. 
* !post #6642639: Qipao with extremely [[highleg]] side slits. 
* !post #6051354: Variety of exaggeratedly-revealing qipao dresses. 

h4. See also

* [[Deel]]
* [[Tangzhuang]]
* [[Ao dai]]


h4. External links

title: i_just_love_latinas_sonic_(meme)
body:
Originates from a [[meme]] dubbing over an episode of [[Sonic Prime]] with [[sonic the hedgehog|Sonic]] asking [[Shadow the hedgehog|Shadow]] why he wants to go to Mexico, to which Shadow responds with "I just love Latinas, Sonic".

Later a viral TikTok audio would expand on the meme, with Shadow going on a long rant about his love for Latinas:

"Shoutout to all the Latinas. The goth ones, the cowboy boot wearing ones, the crazy ones, I don't care. I see a Latina bitch with white or black toes and I start acting like a damn dog."

Intentional or unintentional to the creator of the meme, [[rouge the bat|Rouge]], a female character often seen alongside Shadow in games, has traits of Honduran white bat and designed after sex appeal of famous Latina actors like Jennifer Lopez.

title: ichinose_yuri
body:
Supporting character in [i][[Gundam Breaker Mobile]][/i]. A high-spirited genki girl from Nippa High. She began Gunpla battling so she could fight against her two older brothers. She wasn't able to win against them by playing normally, so she picked up a few more unconventional tricks. Her goal is to have fun playing with other people and therefore doesn't mind losing as long as she has fun. She is also a notorious autograph hound.

After competing with them in various tournaments, she befriends the Soukai Academy Gunpla Club as a friendly rival and frequent sparring partner. Often paired with [[Kotomori Ren]] as an outsider odd-couple friend duo. Her romantic interest is routinely implied to be [[Nogami Kenji]].

Typically seen in her simple [[school uniform]] consisting of a [[dress shirt]] and [[plaid_skirt|plaid]] [[pleated_skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], over which she wears a thick [[orange jacket]]. Wears her [[short_hair|short]] [[brown hair]] tied in a [[high ponytail]] like a [[topknot]]. Has markedly [[large_breasts|larger breasts]] than most of the female cast, rivalling even the adults.

Gunpla:
- [[Gundam Astray Red Frame Flame]]

title: dushevnaya_(girls'_frontline_2)
body:
An android imprinted with [[KSVK 12.7]] [[anti-materiel rifle]] in [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]], [[ksvk (girls' frontline)|returning]] from the [[Girls' Frontline|first game]]. Voiced by Oozeki Eri.

Originally rendered "Душевный" (Duševnyj/Dushevnyy) on Chinese servers prior to GFL2 (which was a word, not a name, something corrected in the foreign servers as "Душевная" or Dushevnaya), her name roughly means "Soulful".

Badly damaged during the time gap between GFL1 and GFL2, Dushevnaya was rescued by [[Suomi (girls' frontline 2)|]] during the GFL2 event [i]Sojourners of the Glass Island[/i], and repaired with what parts were available to the Doll Community, a group of independent dolls. Due to this, her body now has a much more mechanical appearance and she lost her memories of her time at Giffin & Kryuger. She later formally joins as a member of the Doll Community.

title: boxcutter
body:
A [[knife]], also known as a utility knife, with a replaceable blade used for cutting open boxes.

These types of knives come in two basic forms: a solid blade or a snap(off) blade. The solid blade uses a single solid blade that requires replacing when it become dull. The snap blade design uses a single long segmented blade with which you can snap off the leading end when it dulls to once again have a sharp tip. The blade can then be replaced after you run out of usable segments.

The most common style depicted on Danbooru is the snap blade design; this may be due to the fact that the snap blade design was introduced by a Japanese company in 1956. 

It is often featured with themes of [[self-harm]].

h4. Examples

* !post #19284: solid blade
* !post #7406913: snap(off) blade

h4. See also

* [[razor blade]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Utility Knife":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Utility_knife]

title: allie_summers_(parasyte123)
body:
Original character belonging to artist Parasyte123 - Allie is actually an alternate timeline version of his main OC, Elly Hamilton, who fell into a wormhole that transported her to the main timeline while on a mission that saw the deaths of her closest friends and first husband. The transition between timelines turned her eyes and hair a different color. The only memento she has of her original world is the pendant around her neck, a gift from her late husband.

Her daughter, [[Sephira Summers (Parasyte123)]] came from yet another timeline.

title: howto:character
body:
In images on Danbooru, all identifiable characters should be tagged and their tag set as a character tag.

h5. What defines a character?

Generally, it is self-evident who are characters and what aren't. For example, [[Edward Elric]], [[Pikachu]], and [[Simon (ttgl)|]] are obviously characters, while the [[philosopher's stone]], [[Ecruteak City]], and the [[core drill]] are not.

However, sometimes it isn't as clear cut. While there is no official policy on what a character is, the unofficial rule of thumb seems to be: [b]If it talks, acts on its own, or is otherwise shown to be sentient in the source material (game, anime, manga, novel), it is a character.[/b]

Thus, something can be considered a character even if it is an object, for example [[Bardiche (nanoha)|]] or Plankton's computer wife [[Karen (spongebob)|]].

h5. What types of things SHOULD NOT be a character tag?

Locations and non-[[mecha]] vehicles are not characters. (See forum #34022)

Sometimes, artists draw an object (computer, software, vehicle, food, etc.) as a humanoid. This is called a [[personification]]. However, the object is still not considered a character, so it should remain a general tag. If the personified version becomes a character in its own right, a separate character tag can be created for it. For example, [[strawberry]] is the food and [[strawberry-chan]] is the personification.

h5. How to make a character tag.

To make a tag be a character tag, prefix it with "character:" or "char:". Remember to replace spaces with underscores (like_this).

h6. Name and Name Order

Character tags should be the same name and name order that are used in the original source material. For example, [[Kiyama Hiroto]], not "Hiroto Kiyama" or "Xavier Foster". If an alternate name, such as a nickname or a name from the English version, is widely used, you may "request an alias":[/bulk_update_requests/new] from that to the original language title.

However, some copyrights are [b]exceptions[/b] to this rule. Characters from the following should be tagged with their [b]English-language names[/b] when possible:
* [b][[Ace Attorney]] (Gyakuten Saiban)[/b]
* [b][[Advance Wars]] (Famicom Wars)[/b]
* [b][[Animal Crossing]] (Doubutsu no Mori)[/b]
* [b][[Castlevania (series)|]] (Akumajou Dracula)[/b]
* [b][[Final Fantasy]][/b]
* [b][[Fire Emblem]][/b]
** <tn>To be tagged with the names used in the North American localizations (preferably [i]Fire Emblem Heroes[/i]). See topic #16149.</tn>
* [b][[Golden Sun]] (Ougon no Taiyou)[/b]
* [b][[Granblue Fantasy]][/b]
* [b][[Kid Icarus]] (Hikari Shinwa)[/b]
* [b][[Mario (series)|]][/b]
* [b][[Mega Man (series)|]] (Rockman)[/b]
* [b][[Monster Hunter (series)|]][/b]
* [b][[Pokemon]][/b] (human and creature)
* [b][[Splatoon (series)|]][/b]
* [b][[Tales of (series)|Tales of...]][/b]
* [b][[Xenoblade Chronicles (series)|]][/b]

h6. Follow [[howto:romanize]].

If you are unsure how to romanize the character's name, ask in a comment or on the forum.

h6. Only one name?

Whenever possible, characters should be tagged with their full name. However, some characters are only known by a single name (like [[Chen]]). Other times, their full name may be considered a spoiler. Usually these should be tagged with the single name, adding a _(series) qualifier if it is ambiguous. (See [[help:qualifiers]])
If only their surname is known (e.g. same as their spouse or children), or if the full name is not well-known, it may be appropriate to tag them Mr. or Mrs. Surname. (or Dr. or Professor, etc)

Examples:

* [[asuna_(sao)]]
* [[yamada_(b-gata_h-kei)]]
* [[bobby_(fma)]]
* [[yuki_(touhou)]]
* [[mrs._bradley]]
* [[mr._koiwai]]

However, if a character is from a game which is self-titled (title comes from character's name, resulting in a [code]character_(series)[/code] copyright tags), it should be left off. Example:

* [[Mario]] of [[Mario (Series)]]
* [[Kirby]] of [[Kirby (Series)]]

In the case of [[original]] characters, the tag should be qualified using the name of the person who designed it. This includes artists as well as non-artists, such as commissioners. The qualifier should be consistent with the name of the artist tag used on the site. Examples:

* [[Lokulo-chan (Lokulo no Mawashimono)]] by the artist [[Lokulo no Mawashimono]]
* [[Alyssa (SpeckTech)]] by the commissioner SpeckTech

h6. No name!

If the character has no known name but is still recognizable in images (or if their name is a [[spoilers|spoiler]]), a succinct description can be used as a tag for them. If there is consensus among how fans of the series refer to them, use that. If the tag may be ambiguous, add a _(series) or _(artist) qualifier for copyrighted and [[original]] characters respectively.

Copyrighted examples:

* [[idoko]]
* [[idoko's_stepsister]]
* [[giha_village_chief]]
* [[nurse_(katawa_shoujo)]]
* [[girl_with_bear_(madoka_magica)]]
* [[lady_in_red_(ib)]]
* [[mysterious_boy_(angel_beats!)]]
* [[man_with_watch]]
* [[kyon's sister]]
* [[girl_from_the_illusionary_world]]
* [[jyushimatsu's_girlfriend]]

[[Original]] examples:

* [[Red Girl (Yuuhagi (Amaretto-no-Natsu))]]
* [[Black-haired Demon Girl (Shimmer)]]
* [[Big Sister (navigavi)]]

h6. Titles and honorifics

Generally, characters do not have honorifics or titles in their names, as the honorific changes depending on who is addressing the character. However, some characters have the honorific or title as a permanent part of their name such as [[Chouzetsusaikawa Tenshi-chan]] or [[Mr. C.B. (umamusume)|]] In these cases, keep the honorific or title intact. In cases where a character is frequently addressed by their title, a utility alias can be created to help find the character, such as the alias from Arthur Kirkland -> [[United Kingdom (Hetalia)]].

h6. Alternate identities, [[genderswap]]s, and other derivatives

If a character has alternate identities or forms which are visually distinct, these are tagged as well. Use the official name, or if there is none, the agreed-upon fan referent. [b]Alternate forms may be [[spoilers|spoiler]], so be careful when tagging.[/b] Depending on the situation, the tag for the regular identity may be used with the alternate identity as well. Alternate identity tags may be character-type or general-type; again, it depends on the situation.

Examples:

* [[awakened_miki]]
* [[sakura_miku]]
* [[ex-keine]]
* [[kyonko]]

Not every genderswap gets their own character tag; only the ones that are popular enough to have established genderswap names.

Exception is for younger or older versions of the character, these are covered by the regular character tag, plus whichever applicable age tags: [[aged down]], [[baby]], [[toddler]], [[child]], [[aged up]], [[old_woman]], [[old_man]], etc.

h6. Cosplays - One character wearing another's costume

Add both characters tags (the cosplayer and character they're dressing as) and a third general *_(cosplay) tag for the costume. So [[yakumo ran|Ran]] wearing a Pikachu suit would need:

* [[cosplay]]
* [[yakumo_ran]]
* [[pikachu_(cosplay)]]
* [[pikachu]] 

This can be accomplished by just tagging [[yakumo_ran]] and [[pikachu_(cosplay)]], as cosplay tags automatically imply both the character tag and the [[cosplay]] tag.
(see forum #1261)

title: bold_and_brash_(spongebob)
body:
A famous painting by one [[Squidward Tentacles]]. Known for its [b]bold[/b] colour and [b]brash[/b] posing.
[spoiler]It belongs in the trash.[/spoiler]

title: jamila_pose
body:
A pose done to make oneself resemble the character [[Jamila (ultra series)|]] from [[Ultraman (1st series)|]]. By pushing the neckline of one's shirt all the way to the top of your head, so that your face can be seen flush with it, you end up recreating Jamila's appearance as a headless being with his face at the top of his chest by his shoulders.

In the West, the most well-known depiction of the Jamila pose is from [[Kill Me Baby]]'s [[Kill Me Dance]], where recreating it serves as the 12th step in the dance out of 16.

h4. See also

* Pixpedia: "ジャミラ (ネタ要員として)":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E3%82%B8%E3%83%A3%E3%83%9F%E3%83%A9#h3_21]

title: daidouji_tomoyo_(chef:_tomoyo)
body:
A costume that [[Daidouji Tomoyo]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically during the ending credits song for the third season, titled [i]Fruits Candy[/i]. [[Kinomoto Sakura]] likewise has a [[kinomoto sakura (shopgirl: mint)|Fruits Candy costume]] of her own.

Tomoyo's costume consists of a [[pink bow|pink]] [[hair bow]], a [[pink dress]] beneath a [[white apron]], [[white socks]], and [[pink footwear|pink]] [[slippers]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(night_star)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episodes 68 and 69 during [spoiler]her final battle against [[Hiiragizawa Eriol]].[/spoiler] The manga uses the [[kinomoto sakura (final pink and black costume)|Final Pink and Black Costume]] for the same events. Take care not to confuse this outfit with her [[kinomoto sakura (constellations)|Starry Yellow dress]] from [[cardcaptor sakura clear card arc|Clear Card Arc]].

She wears a [[yellow hat]], a [[white capelet|white]] and [[yellow capelet]] with an orange star on the front, a two-sided [[white cape|white]] and [[red cape]], [[red shorts]], and [[yellow thighhighs|yellow]] [[thigh boots]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(constellations)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in [[cardcaptor sakura clear card arc|Clear Card Arc]], specifically in episode 7. Take care not to confuse this outfit with her [[kinomoto sakura (night star)|Yellow Star costume]] from the 90s anime.

She wears star ornaments in her hair, a pale [[yellow dress]] with puffy sleeves and star ornaments, [[white pantyhose]], and pale [[yellow footwear|yellow]] [[shoes]].

body:
[[Official alternate costume]]s for [[Ally_(puyopuyo)|]], found in [[Puyopuyo Quest]].

Based off of [[Kinomoto Sakura]]'s [[school uniform]] and [[kinomoto sakura (silk ribbon)|pink ribbon dress]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(silk_ribbon)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in [[cardcaptor sakura clear card arc|Clear Card Arc]], specifically in episode 2.

She wears a [[pink hat]] with striped ribbons, a striped bow on the front of a [[pink capelet]], a [[pink dress]], [[white gloves]], a striped ribbon on her right leg, and [[pink thighhighs|pink]] [[thigh boots]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(lotus)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in [[cardcaptor sakura clear card arc|Clear Card Arc]], specifically in episode 4.

She wears a Chinese-themed blue-and-yellow shirt with lotus flower print on the front, [[blue pants]], and [[blue footwear|blue]] [[shoes]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(fluffy_sheep)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 52 when she changes the [[Erase (clow card)|]] [[Clow Card]] into a [[Sakura Card]]. Although modeled after a jester, this outfit is given the name [b]Blue Sheep[/b] to differentiate it from her episode 3 [[kinomoto sakura (water fairy)|Blue Jester Costume]], and also because in episode 52, Sakura is trapped in a hole and thousands of toy sheep are falling on top of her. Take care not to confuse with either the Blue Jester costume or the [[kinomoto sakura (water drop)|Marine Jester costume]] from [[cardcaptor sakura clear card arc|Clear Card Arc]].

She wears a [[blue hat|blue]] two-pointed [[jester cap]], a [[blue cape]] over [[yellow shorts]], [[yellow gloves]], [[white pantyhose]], and [[blue footwear|blue]] [[pointed footwear|pointed shoes]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(water_fairy)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 3 when she captures the [[Watery (clow card)|]] Card. Be sure not to confuse this outfit for her [[kinomoto sakura (fluffy sheep)|Blue Sheep costume]] from episode 52, or her [[kinomoto sakura (water drop)|Marine Jester costume]] from [[cardcaptor sakura clear card arc|Clear Card Arc]].

She wears a [[blue hat|blue]] [[jester cap]], a [[white dress|white]] jester-themed dress over a [[blue leotard]], [[blue gloves|blue]] [[elbow gloves]], and [[blue footwear|blue]] [[pointed footwear|pointed shoes]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(water_drop)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in [[cardcaptor sakura clear card arc|Clear Card Arc]], specifically in episode 9. Take care not to confuse this with either the [[kinomoto sakura (water fairy)|Blue Jester costume]] or the [[kinomoto sakura (fluffy sheep)|Blue Sheep costume]]s from the 90s anime.

She wears a [[blue hat|blue]] [[jester cap]], a [[blue dress|blue]] jester-themed dress over a [[blue skirt]], [[blue gloves|blue]] [[elbow gloves]], and [[blue thighhighs|blue]] [[thigh boots]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(parade)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in [[cardcaptor sakura clear card arc|Clear Card Arc]], specifically in episode 11.

She wears a blue-and-white [[garrison cap]], a [[blue shirt]] with a [[red neckerchief]], [[blue pants]], and [[white footwear|white]] [[boots]].

body:
[[Official alternate costume]] for [[Amitie_(puyopuyo)|]], from [[Puyopuyo Quest]].

Based off of [[Kinomoto Sakura]]'s [[kinomoto sakura (frog)|frog raincoat]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(frog)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in [[cardcaptor sakura clear card arc|Clear Card Arc]], specifically in episode 3.

As the name implies, she wears a [[green coat|green]] [[raincoat]] modeled after a [[frog]], along with a [[frog hood]], [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[green sleeves]], [[white socks|white]] [[kneehighs]], and [[green footwear|green]] [[boots]].

* !asset #22975406

h4. Other media
* This outfit appears as a costume for [[Amitie (puyopuyo)|]] in [[Puyopuyo Quest]], called {{Amitie_(kinomoto_sakura)_(puyopuyo)|Amitie ver. Kinomoto Sakura}}.

title: kinomoto_sakura_(blaze)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in [[cardcaptor sakura clear card arc|Clear Card Arc]], specifically in episode 18.

She wears a flame-themed hair ornament, a [[red shirt]], puffy [[white pants]] with orange flame patterns at the bottom, a loose belt around her waist, and [[red footwear|red]] [[shoes]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(clear_wings)
body:
The outfit that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the [[Cardcaptor Sakura Clear Card Arc|Clear Card Arc]]'s first opening, [i]CLEAR[/i].

She wears a crystalline [[pointed crown]], a [[white dress]] embellished with blue crystals and white feathers, [[white gloves]], crystal ornaments over her bare legs, and [[white footwear|white]] [[shoes]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(future)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 6 when she successfully captures the [[Illusion (clow card)|]] Card.

She wears a [[yellow hairband]] with a headset, large yellow shoulder pads, an umbrella-themed [[yellow dress]], [[white gloves]], [[white thighhighs]], and [[white footwear|white]] [[sneakers]] with wings.

title: kinomoto_sakura_(final_pink_and_black_costume)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] only wears in the manga, specifically in chapter 43 during [spoiler]her final battle against [[Hiiragizawa Eriol]].[/spoiler] The 90s anime replaces this costume with the [[kinomoto sakura (night star)|Yellow Star Costume]] for the same events in episodes 68 and 69.

She wears a [[pink hat]] with a yellow star ornament and black braided tassels, a [[black vest]], [[pink gloves]], a [[pink dress]], [[black pantyhose]], and [[pink footwear|pink]] [[shoes]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(red_blue)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 15 when she captures the [[Storm (clow card)|]] Card.

She wears a [[blue hat|blue]] [[witch hat]], a two-sided blue and red cape with a wing brooch, a [[black shirt]], [[black gloves]], [[blue shorts]], [[blue thighhighs]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]].

title: big_(clow_card)
body: A [[Clow Card]] from [[Cardcaptor Sakura]]. One of the 34 cards introduced in the anime, capable of growing people and objects in size. Its opposing card is the [[Little (clow card)|]] card. Sakura captures it in episode 31, and is used to make Sakura grow in size to fight a pink dragon that the [[Create (clow card)|]] card made. She wears her [[kinomoto sakura (hero)|Warrior costume]] when capturing both cards.

title: create_(clow_card)
body: A [[Clow Card]] from [[Cardcaptor Sakura]]. One of the 34 cards introduced in the anime, capable of bringing creatures or objects into existence. It is captured in episode 31, when Sakura uses the [[Big (clow card)|]] to grow in size to challenge a pink dragon that the Create card made. She wears her [[kinomoto sakura (hero)|Warrior costume]] to capture both cards in this episode.

title: kinomoto_sakura_(hero)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 31 when she captures both the [[Big (clow card)|]] and [[Create (clow card)|]] Cards.

She wears a pair of yellow wing ornaments in her hair, a blue-and-white form-fitting set of shorts with a yellow winged motif over the shoulders, a pair of large [[blue ribbon]]s on the back, and [[blue thighhighs|blue]] [[thigh boots]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(commander)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 50 when she rescues [[Li Syaoran]] using the [[Sword (clow card)|]] Card's power.

She wears a [[grey hat]], a [[white jacket]] over a white-and-grey dress, [[grey gloves]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[thigh boots]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(memories)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 16 when she visits her great-grandfather. It used to belong to her mother [[Kinomoto Nadeshiko]], who was a fan of Victorian-themed clothing.

She wears a [[white hat]] with a wide brim and [[black bow]], a [[white dress]] beneath a layer of red fabric, a black [[waist bow]], [[white socks]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[shoes]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(winter_bunny)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 36 when she captures the [[Snow (clow card)|]] Card.

She wears a red rabbit-themed winter coat, [[orange gloves]], [[yellow bloomers]], [[white pantyhose]], and [[red footwear|red]] [[boots]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(shadowy_night)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 2 when she captures the [[Shadow (clow card)|]] Card.

She wears a [[red hat]] with [[blue ribbon]]s, a [[red cape]] with a [[red bow]] on the front, a [[white vest]] over a [[blue leotard]], [[white gloves]], [[blue thighhighs]], and [[white footwear|white]] [[shoes]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(macaron)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 20 when she captures the [[Fight (clow card)|]] Card.

She wears a [[pink hat]] with a [[pink bow]], a distinctly puffy [[pink dress]] with a [[white bow]] on the front and back, [[white gloves]], [[white pantyhose]], and [[pink footwear|pink]] [[mary janes]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(sakura_prince)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 42 when she partakes in a school play, and likewise captures the [[Light (clow card)|]] and [[Dark (clow card)|]] Cards. [[Li Syaoran]] humorously wears a princess costume to complement Sakura's prince outfit.

She wears a [[blue hat]] with white plumed feathers, a [[blue jacket]], a [[red neckerchief]], a [[white cape]]. puffy [[red shorts]], and [[black thighhighs|black]] [[thigh boots]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(rainy_night_sakura)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 47 when she tries to change the [[Clow Card]]s into [[Sakura Card]]s.

She wears an [[orange hat|orange]] [[jester cap]], a two-sided yellow and blue [[cape]], [[orange shorts]], [[orange gloves]], and [[yellow thighhighs|yellow]] [[thigh boots]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(white_bunny)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 6 when she attempts to capture the [[Illusion (clow card)|]] Card but fails.

She dons a pair of white [[rabbit ears]], a [[blue leotard]] with yellow [[pom pom (clothes)|pom poms]], puffy [[pink sleeves]] and [[pink shorts]], a yellow [[rabbit tail]], [[white pantyhose]], and [[blue footwear|blue]] [[shoes]] with yellow pom poms.

title: kinomoto_sakura_(starlit_dream)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 59 when she transforms the [[Shadow (clow card)|]] Card.

She wears a [[purple hat]] with a pink star ornament, a [[purple capelet]], a [[pink dress]], [[purple gloves]], and [[purple thighhighs|purple]] [[thigh boots]].

title: thunder_(clow_card)
body: A [[Clow Card]] from [[Cardcaptor Sakura]]. One of the original 19 cards from the manga, capable of manipulating electricity. Sakura captures it in episode 8 with help from the [[Shadow (clow card)|]] card. She wears her [[kinomoto sakura (kitty)|Pink Kitty costume]] while capturing the Thunder card.

title: kinomoto_sakura_(kitty)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 8 when she captures the [[Thunder (clow card)|]] Card.

She wears a pair of black [[cat ears]], a [[black dress]] layered beneath another [[pink dress]], a [[jingle bell]] over her neck, [[black pantyhose]], and [[pink footwear|pink]] [[boots]]. In the manga, the pink dress is colored [[white dress|white]] instead.

title: kinomoto_sakura_(twin_night)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in both the 90s anime and manga, specifically in episode 43 when she captures the [[Twin (clow card)|]] Card, and in chapter 13 of the manga when she captures the [[Shield (clow card)|]] Card.

She wears a [[pink hat]], a [[pink jacket]] with black trim, [[black gloves]], [[black shorts]], and [[black thighhighs|black]] [[thigh boots]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(fluffy_down)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 4 when she captures the [[Rain (clow card)|]] and [[Wood (clow card)|]] Cards.

She wears a [[pink hairband]] with white wings, a [[pink dress]] with puffy white trim, puffy white sleeves and gloves, [[white thighhighs]], and [[white footwear|white]] [[shoes]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(awakened_sakura)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 48 when she transformed the [[Firey (clow card)|]] Card into a Star Card.

She wears a [[pink hat]], a [[pink skirt]], [[yellow gloves]], cream-colored shorts, and pink-and-cream colored [[boots]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(musical_notes)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 23 when she captures the [[Song (clow card)|]] Card.

She wears a [[pink hat]] with a musical note, a [[white capelet]], a [[pink dress]] with a musical note on the front, white gloves, and [[red footwear|red]] [[shoes]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(dark_night)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 7 when she captures the [[Silent (clow card)|]] Card.

She wears a [[green hat]], a [[green shirt]] with blue argyle patterns and black [[bat wings]], [[black gloves]], [[green shorts]], and [[green thighhighs|green]] [[thigh boots]] with blue argyle patterns.

title: kinomoto_sakura_(green_sprite)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 30 when she captures the [[Dash (clow card)|]] Card.

She wears a [[green hat|green]] [[jester cap]], an [[orange vest]] over a [[green shirt]] and [[green shorts]], [[green gloves]], [[green thighhighs]], and [[orange footwear|orange]] [[shoes]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(fairy)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 12 when she captures the [[Time (clow card)|]] Card.

She wears a [[yellow skirt]] over [[yellow bloomers]], [[yellow scrunchie]]s on her neck, arms and wrists, [[white footwear|white]] [[shoes]] and [[green wings|green]] [[fairy wings]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(dream_sakura)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episodes 45 and 46 when she [spoiler]has to fight against [[Yue (cardcaptor sakura)|]] to pass the Final Judgment so she can become the new mistress of the Clow Cards.[/spoiler]

She wears a [[pink hat]] with a yellow stripe at the top, a [[pink capelet]] over a [[pink cape]], a [[white leotard]] with long sleeves, [[white gloves]], [[yellow shorts|yellow puffy shorts]], [[blue thighhighs]], and [[white footwear|white]] [[sneakers]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(splendor)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 58 when she [spoiler]tries to change [[Yue (cardcaptor sakura)|]] and [[Kerberos]] back to their false forms.[/spoiler]

She wears a pair of blue [[pom pom (clothes)|pom poms]] with [[yellow ribbon]]s in her hair, a [[blue vest]] over a [[blue dress]], a [[black bodysuit]] beneath the dress, [[blue gloves]], and [[blue footwear|blue]] [[boots]].

title: watery_(clow_card)
body: A [[Clow Card]] from [[Cardcaptor Sakura]]. One of the original 19 cards from the manga, capable of controlling water. Sakura captures it in episode 3 of the anime after she locks it in a walk-in freezer. Sakura wears her [[kinomoto sakura (water fairy)|Blue Jester costume]] for this episode.

title: kinomoto_sakura_(princess_dreams)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 24 when she captures the [[Little (clow card)|]] Card.

It is a [[blue dress]] with a [[white apron]], a [[pink bow]] in her hair, a [[white bow]] at the back, [[white thighhighs]], and [[blue footwear|blue]] [[mary janes]]. In the manga, her hair bow is colored [[blue bow|blue]] instead.

title: andou_ringo_(kinamoto_sakura)
body:
[[Official alternate costume]] for [[Andou Ringo]], found in [[Puyopuyo Quest]]. 

It is based off of the [[kinomoto sakura (miraculous sakura)|Winged Egg Crown Costume]] worn by [[Kinomoto Sakura]] of [[Cardcaptor Sakura]].

h4. See also
* [[amitie_(kinomoto_sakura)_(puyopuyo)|Amitie ver. Sakura Kinomoto]]

title: kinomoto_sakura_(miraculous_sakura)
body:
The costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the second opening of the 90s anime, [i]Tobira wo Akete[/i] ("Open the Door").

It is a [[yellow dress]] over [[yellow bloomers]] with a [[yellow neckerchief]] pinned with a yellow wing-shaped brooch, a [[gold crown|gold]] [[pointed crown]], light yellow wings [[yellow gloves|yellow]] [[elbow gloves]], [[yellow thighhighs]], and [[yellow footwear|yellow]] [[shoes]].

h4. In other media
* [[Puyopuyo Quest]]: A collaboration event between PPQ and CS gave [[Andou Ringo]] a new [[official alternate costume|costume]] based off this costume: [[andou_ringo_(kinamoto_sakura)|Ringo Andou ver. Sakura Kinomoto]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(princess_costume)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in the second movie when [[Daidouji Tomoyo]] designs it for a school play. [[Li Syaoran]] wears a prince-themed costume to complement Sakura's princess outfit. Take care not to confuse this outfit with her [[kinomoto sakura (astral sakura)|Platinum Star dress]], which are very similar in design and coloration.

She wears a dress that is either depicted [[white dress|white]] or light [[pink dress|pink]], a [[red choker|red]] [[star choker]], [[red ribbon]]s around her legs, a frilled thighlet on her left leg, and [[red footwear|red]] [[shoes]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(astral_sakura)
body:
The costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the third opening of the 90s anime, [i]Platinum[/i]. She also wears it in the crossover game [[Magical Battle Arena]]. Take care not to confuse this outfit with her [[kinomoto sakura (princess costume)|Princess costume]] from the second movie.

It is a [[white dress|white]] [[frilled dress]], [[layered dress|layered]] over a [[pink dress]], with [[white wings]], a [[frilled choker|frilled]] [[pink choker|pink]] [[star choker]], [[white footwear|white]] [[shoes]], and a [[single thighhigh|single]] [[white thighhighs|white thighhigh]] on her left leg

title: kinomoto_sakura_(magician)
body:
One of [[Kinomoto Sakura]]'s costumes that [[Daidouji Tomoyo]] made for her, and easily the most recognizable and popular one. Sakura wears it in the anime's first opening song [i]Catch You Catch Me[/i], though she's never actually depicted capturing Clow Cards while wearing it despite how well-known it is. Due to this costume's popularity, it can also be attributed to [[parody|parodies]] where other characters are wearing an adapted variant of it.

It is a [[pink dress]] over a [[white shirt|white blouse]] with [[puffy sleeves]] and a [[red bow]], a [[pink hat|pink]] [[mob cap]] with a [[pink bow]], [[white wings]], [[white gloves]] with a red bow, [[white thighhighs]], and [[red footwear|red]] [[mary janes]].

title: da_capo_v
body:
h4.Characters

* [[Yasaka Menoa]]

title: fish_hook
body:
A small metal [[hook]] attached to a fishing line that is used to [[fishing|catch fish]].

h4.See also

* [[Hook hand]]

title: hook_hand
body:
The character has a prosthetic hook replacing a lost hand. It may be a prop, or an actual replacement for the hand. Popularly associated with [[pirate]]s due to [[Captain Hook]], which [[Crocodile (one Piece)|]] directly [[parody|parodies]].

h4.See also

* [[Hook]]
* [[Fish hook]]
* [[Split hook hand]]

title: fishing
body:
As a verb, it is the act of catching [[fish]]. As a noun, fishing refers to the recreational sport. Most examples of fishing on Danbooru are of the type performed with a [[fishing rod]] and baited hook, but methods of fishing vary widely, from fishing with [[net|nets]] to fishing with [[solar gun|solar guns]] and [[harpoon|harpoons]] (spearfishing) to the use of [[explosive|explosives]] (dynamite fishing). Fishing may be done from a [[boat]], from a [[shore]] or [[pier]], or while [[underwater]].

h4. See also

* [[fish hook]]
* [[fishing line]]
* [[fishing lure]]
* [[fishing net]]
* [[fishing rod]]
* [[harpoon]]
* [[tackle box]]

title: hook
body:
Any type of curved weapon with a sharp point at the end attached to a rope. The weapon pierces the target and ensnares them, and then drags them toward the weapon user.

h4.See also

* [[Fish hook]]
* [[Hook hand]]

title: tackle_box
body:
A portable [[box]] for carrying [[fishing]] gear. Usually features a carrying handle and individual compartments for [[fish hook|hooks]], [[fishing_lure|lures]], and other small items.

h4.See also
* [[toolbox]]

title: fishing_rod
body: A tool used to [[fishing|catch fish]] with a [[fishing line|line]] and [[fish hook|hook]].

title: tokoyami_towa_(7th_costume)
body:
The 7th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Tokoyami Towa]], as seen on "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/tokoyamitowa/status/1791449676773998649].

It consists of a [[white shirt]] [[long sleeves|long]] [[wide sleeves|wide]] [[black sleeves]] with a [[high collar]] and [[shoulder cutout]], an [[underbust]] [[black corset]], [[white shorts]] [[purple socks|purple]] [[ankle socks]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[lace-up boots|lace-up]] [[ankle boots]], she also has an optional [[capelet]]. She also has a [[ear chain]] on her left ear.

She has 2 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume, both of which have [[swept bangs|swept]] [[braided bangs]]:
* [[long hair|Long]] [[wavy hair]] with a [[hair bow]]
* [[Short hair]] with a [[x hair ornament]]

title: bernadetta_von_varley
body:
Character from [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]]. A member of the Black Eagles.

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[purple hair]], [[grey eyes]], and [[small breasts]]. She has two different designs, one as a teenager and one as an adult. The teenager design features her own version of the [[Garreg Mach Monastery Uniform]] in her case being a [[long sleeves|long sleeved]] [[black coat]] with [[gold trim]] and a [[black skirt]], additionally her version includes a [[hoodie]], [[black shorts|black]] [[bike shorts]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[thigh boots]]. The adult design features a [[strapless dress|strapless]] [[purple dress|purple]] [[short dress]] with [[long sleeves]] which may potentially show [[cleavage]] and her upper back, [[yellow gloves|yellow]]/[[purple gloves]], [[purple shorts|purple]] [[bike shorts]] and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[boots]].

She has anxiety issues [spoiler]due to her abusive father[/spoiler] and often hides in her room to avoid interacting with other people. In-game, she excels as an archer with high speed and dexterity, but weak durability.

Voiced by [[Erica Mendez]] (English), [[Tsuji Ayumi]] (Japanese).

title: lorenz_hellman_gloucester
body:
Character in [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]] and member of the Golden Deer.

A noble who often takes his duties seriously and is very prideful about his status. Although, he can be unintentionally be seen as classist and pretentious to those around him, especially commonfolk. However, he has an affinity for tea and writing poetry.

[spoiler]After the five-year timeskip, he has grown out of his classist views, believing the value of a person should be based on the quality of their soul, regardless of their upbringing.[/spoiler]

Voiced by: "Benjamin Diskin":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benjamin_Diskin] (English), "Watanabe Hiroshi":[https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/encyclopedia/people.php?id=134753] (Japanese).

Not to be confused with [[Lorenz (fire emblem)|]], a character from [[Fire Emblem: Shadow Dragon and the Blade of Light]] and [[Fire Emblem: Mystery of the Emblem]].

body:
Character from [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]] and a member of the Golden Deer.

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[orange hair]], [[orange eyes]], and [[medium breasts]] ([[large breasts|large]] after the in-game timeskip).

A commoner from the Leicester Alliance, she looks up to [[Jeralt Reus Eisner|Captain Jeralt]] and wants to become a mercenary like him.

In-game, Leonie has high speed and dexterity, as well as reasonable strength and physical durability, but she's very weak to magic and doesn't use magic well herself. She's considered one of the best characters in the game statistically because of her good stat growths and lack of skill weaknesses.

title: claude_von_riegan
body:
Main character in [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]].

He is the leader of the Golden Deer house and heir to House Riegan.

Claude is a cunning and unpredictable strategist with an easygoing attitude. Despite this, he is a lot more knowledgeable than he lets on. His schemes generally involve mind games and dirty tactics to throw his foes off. He likes feasts, long rides, archery and topics of curiosity.

[spoiler]He is also the crown prince to Almyra and was discriminated due to his mixed heritage. His dream is to break cultural barriers between Fódlan and Almyra and open Fódlan to the outside world. His real name is Khalid.[/spoiler]

Voiced by: [[Joe Zieja]] (English), [[Toyonaga Toshiyuki]] (Japanese)

title: marianne_von_edmund
body:
Character in [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]] and member of the Golden Deer.

She has [[blue hair]] typically worn with a [[crown braid]], [[brown eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. She is commonly depicted with [[bags under eyes]] and a shadow over her face before the time skip. After the time skip when she is older, these go away.

She has low self-esteem and dislikes talking to people. However, [[hilda_valentine_goneril|Hilda]] is generally depicted as her only friend. She's also fond of animals, in particular horses.

[spoilers]Her low self-esteem is caused by her blood carrying the Crest of the Beast, belonging to a hero who was long lost to history, which promises contempt for those who bear it. It corresponds to the tarot of the Devil, who is also commonly known as "the Beast". She is acutely aware of this and keeps it a secret. As a result, she is deeply religious.[/spoiler]

Remarkably, she ended in the Top 1 of the 2021's edition of "Choose Your Legends":[https://vote5.campaigns.fire-emblem-heroes.com/en-us] (women's side), making her the first non-main character to win the event, alongside the [[Gatekeeper_(fire_emblem)|]].

Voiced by [[Xanthe Huynh]] (English), [[Hata Sawako]] (Japanese).

title: hilda_valentine_goneril
body:
Character in [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]] and a member of the Golden Deer, serving as the de facto "retainer" of [[Claude von Riegan]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[pink hair]], [[pink eyes]], and [[large breasts]].

A girl who has been spoiled by her father and her brother [[Holst Sigiswald Goneril|Holst]], Hilda has a lazy personality and often uses excuses to exempt herself from any work she does not want to do, or uses her physical beauty to charm others into doing tasks for her. Despite being lazy, Hilda is a fashionable and friendly girl who can be genuinely helpful if she puts effort into something.

Not to be confused with [[Hilda (Fire Emblem)|]], a character from [[Fire Emblem: Genealogy of The Holy War]].

Voiced by: "Salli Saffioti":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salli_Saffioti] / Celeste Henderson (English), [[Kuwahara Yuuki]] (Japanese).

title: lysithea_von_ordelia
body:
Character in [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]] and member of the Golden Deer.

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[white hair]], [[pink eyes]], and is [[flat_chest|flat-chested]].

She is a hardworking girl with a no-nonsense attitude who has a desire to improve her abilities. Being the youngest student at 15-years-old, she dislikes being treated like a child and can be impatient with those who annoy her. Despite wanting to look independent and mature, she has an intense fear of ghosts and is an avid lover of sweets, especially cake.

In-game, Lysithea is a very potent mage with unparalleled offensive power, but she has terrible defenses. She is often considered a "Glass Cannon" character, able to annihilate all but the toughest of opponents.

[spoiler]The reason for her impatience is because of her shortened lifespan, caused by being imbued with a second Crest when she was experimented on by Those Who Slither in The Dark.[/spoiler]

Remarkably, she ended in the Top 2 of the 2020's edition of "Choose Your Legends":[https://vote4.campaigns.fire-emblem-heroes.com/en-US/results] (women's side), making her the first non-main character to get a Brave unit in [[Fire Emblem Heroes]].

Voiced by: "Janice Kawaye":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Janice_Kawaye] (English), [[Yuuki Aoi]] (Japanese).

title: persona_4
body:
A Playstation 2 RPG and part of the [[Persona]] series of the [[Megami Tensei]] franchise, released 10 July 2008 in Japan, 9 December 2008 in North America and 13 March 2009 in Europe.

The game follows a [[Narukami Yu|high school junior]] who, due to his parents' work overseas, moves from the city to the rural town of Inaba to live for a year with his uncle and local policeman [[Doujima Ryoutarou]] and his six-year-old daughter Nanako. With his new friends from the local high school, he investigates a series of inexplicable murders and the truth about a TV channel that only appears during midnight, armed with Personas, materialized aspects of their personalities.

Received a enhanced port on the [[Playstation Vita]], and later [[Microsoft Windows]], [[Xbox One]], [[Xbox Series X]] and S and [[Nintendo Switch]], entitled [i][[Persona 4 the Golden]][/i]. It is set in the same universe as its predecessor, [[Persona 3]]. A fighting game, [[Persona 4: The Ultimate in Mayonaka Arena]], also acts as a direct sequel to the game.

Another spinoff is the novel [[Persona X Detective]], taking place 1 year after the events of Persona 4.

title: byakuya_(under_night_in-birth)
body:
Character who appears in [[Under Night In-Birth]]. He is an enigma, following along with his sister, [[Tsukuyomi (Under Night In-Birth)|Tsukuyomi]], as they wander through the Hollow Night. He has no other motive other than to follow his sister's orders, usually involving him sinking the [[claws]] of his EXS, [i]Chelicerata[/i], into unwary victims. [spoiler]It is revealed that he knew Tsukuyomi was in fact, not his real sister. However, he is still willing to help her find what she's searching for.[/spoiler] Fans often liken his appearance to [[Narukami Yu]] of [i][[Persona]][/i] fame.

h5. Voice Actors

[b]JP:[/b] [[Tamura Mutsumi]]


h4. External links

* "Byakuya Under Night In-Birth Wiki Entry":http://in-birth.wikia.com/wiki/Byakuya

title: narukami_yu
body:
The protagonist of [[Persona 4]]. Nephew of [[Doujima Ryoutarou]] and cousin/big brother figure of [[Doujima Nanako]].

Originally nameless in the video game, he is given the name "Seta Souji" in the manga adaptation and "Narukami Yuu" in the anime adaptation.

He is nicknamed [[Banchou]] for a number of reasons:
* His starting Persona, [[Izanagi (persona 4)|]], wears a banchou-style outfit ([[gakuran]] and tall [[geta]])
* In the Miss? Contest, he dresses as a [[sukeban]]
* Compared to the protagonist of [[Persona 3]], [[Yuuki Makoto (persona 3)|]], he has a number of much more manly conversation/action choices

This nickname gained official acknowledgement in the PV for [[Persona 4: The Ultimate in Mayonaka Arena]], in which he is called the "steel siscon banchou" (鋼のシスコン番長).

Voiced by: [[Namikawa Daisuke]] (Japanese), [[Johnny Yong Bosch]] (English)

title: psylocke_(sai)
body: An incarnation of [[Psylocke]] named Sai, a wandering Samurai who hunts Yokai with her psionic powers, first introduced in Marvel's 2021 Demon Days mini comic series set in a Marvel universe that merged with Japanese mythology. This version of Psylocke would later appear in the game [[Marvel Rivals]] as her default skin.

title: lamia_(npc)_(pgr)
body:
Lamia's NPC / boss appearance, prior to the patch 'Cradle Parade'.

h5. Appearance
Lamia is [[cyborg]] / [[monster girl]] in appearance, depicted either in a dinosaur (with [[reverse-jointed legs]] and vertical tail fin) or a [[mermaid]] like lower body with horizontal fin [[fish tail]]. Lamia has [[long hair|long]] [[straight hair|straight]] [[black hair]], overall hair length is [[long hair|long]], has [[long bangs]] [[hair between eyes|between eyes]]. Lamia has bodily features like [[purple eyes|purple]] [[ringed eyes]], sometimes with [[bags under eyes]].

Her skintone is [[pale skin|pale]], both arms are [[mechanical arms|mechanical]] and wears a large [[headgear]]. Her only clothing element are a pair of [[breast curtains]], but it has similar colour to her mechanical arms, depending on depiction it can look like she is wearing a [[shrug (clothing)|]].

Uses a [[polearm]] [[double blade]] as weapon, but the smaller blade can be detached and use as a [[sword]] / [[dual wielding]].

title: undefined_fantastic_object
body:
東方星蓮船 ("Touhou Seirensen") ~ Undefined Fantastic Object 
("Star-Lotus Ship of the East") 

Fifteenth game of the [[Touhou]] series, twelfth of the mainstream lineup, and tenth of the Windows generation, as well as the seventh mainstream game of the same generation.

As early as spring rumors abound of a [[palanquin_ship|flying treasure ship]]. Three human girls - [[Hakurei Reimu]], [[Kirisame Marisa]] and [[Kochiya Sanae]] - hold a race to see who gets first to the ship, unaware of its true purpose - the rescue of an [[hijiri_byakuren|ageless mage]] - and a [[houjuu_nue|shadowy figure]] trailing them...

title: please_stop_beatboxing_(meme)
body:
*Starts Beatboxing* refers to a parody meme format in which images of people and characters covering their mouths while crying or in surprise are intentionally misinterpreted as if they are beatboxing due to the similarity of the gesture. In 2020, a WikiHow image depicting a man crying near his dying partner gained popularity as the Please Stop Beatboxing redraw format.

"Knowyourmeme":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/starts-beatboxing-please-stop-beatboxing]

title: common_kingfisher
body:
Latin: [i]Alcedo atthis[/i]
JP: カワセミ [i]kawasemi[/i]

This sparrow-sized kingfisher has blue upperparts and orange underparts, with an orange band from beak to behind the eye that turns into a short white neck-level stripe. Like all kingfishers it has a stubby tail and a long bill contoured for catching fish.

It is a year-round resident in Japan and can be found through much of Europe and Asia.

title: ganyu_(genshin_impact)
body:
A playable Cryo character in [[Genshin Impact]].

A half-human, half-[[qilin (mythology)|]] who serves as an emissary and secretary for the Liyue Qixing.

She has [[goat horns]], with [[purple eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] with [[sidelocks]]. She wears a brown [[halterneck]] [[backless_outfit|backless]] [[bodystocking]] along with [[detached sleeves]] and a [[cowbell]] on her [[neck bell|neck]]. She wields [[Amos' Bow (genshin impact)|]].

Due to her resemblance to a [[goat]], a common joke involves her [[lactation|producing milk]], or other characters expecting her to do so. Since one part of the main story involves [[Qiqi (genshin impact)|]] searching for a "Cocogoat", they are frequent partners for this gag.

Her name is pronounced [b]Kan'u[/b] in the Japanese version of the game.

Voiced by [[Ueda Reina]] (Japanese).

title: yelan_(genshin_impact)
body:
A playable Hydro character in [[Genshin Impact]].

body:
A combination of Gurren Lagann and a thermospheric survival platform known as Arc-Gurren. The Arc Gurren-Lagann resembles the Gunbuster, another giant mecha produced by GAINAX.

It is capable of sustaining a small population of people and animals in low earth orbit for at least a year, and contains an array of large-scale defensive systems and weaponry.

title: daredevil
body:
[[Marvel]] superhero who [[superhero costume|wears]] a [[red bodysuit]] with a devil-themed hood. He is blind, but in turn the rest of his senses are heightened, allowing him to observe his surroundings and fight without vision. He primarily fights street-level crime in the Hell's Kitchen district of Manhattan, New York and his civilian identity is the lawyer [[Matt Murdock]].

Recently, [[Elektra Natchios]] has taken up the Daredevil mantle as well. When active as Daredevil, Elektra uses modified blunt [[sai (weapon)|]] with extendable [[cable]]s that allow her to non-lethally subdue enemies.

title: sega_cd
body:
The [b]Sega CD[/b], released as the [b]Mega-CD[/b] (メガCD [i]Mega-Shī Dī[/i]) in most regions outside North America, is an add-on device for the [[Sega Mega Drive]] [[video game]] [[game_console|console]], designed and produced by [[Sega]]. 

As part of the fourth generation of video game consoles, the Sega CD was released in Japan in [[1991]], North America in [[1992]] and in Europe and other regions in [[1993]]. The device adds a CD-ROM drive to the Mega Drive console, allowing the user to play CD-based games and providing additional hardware functionality. Other benefits of the add-on include a faster central processing unit and graphic enhancements. It can also play audio CDs and CD+G discs. The main benefit of the new add-on's technology was its larger disc space, allowing for larger games to be developed. This would manifest itself in the form of full motion video (FMV) games.

By the end of [[1994]], the add-on had sold approximately 2.7 million units worldwide. In [[1995]], it was announced that Sega's support would shift away from the Mega Drive and Sega CD to focus on its new console, the [[Sega Saturn]], and the add-on itself was officially discontinued in [[1996]]. 

Retrospective reception to the add-on is mixed, praising the Sega CD for its individual offerings and additions to the Mega Drive's functions, but criticizing the game library as a whole for its lack of depth and low value for money, as well as issues with how the add-on was supported by Sega.

body:

Common examples include [[twig]]s, [[stick]]s, dry [[leaf|leaves]], pine needles, birch bark, [[dry grass]], [[bird nest]]s, and cottonwood fluff/cattail fluff.

title: twig
body: Small [[branch]] removed from a [[plant]]. Can be seen in a [[mouth hold|character's mouth]] in place of a [[cigarette]], used as a makeshift [[flag]] post for decoration, held like a [[sword]] for extended reach, stuck on a character literally "out of the [[forest|woods]]", or just tinder/[[kindling]] you would find laying on the ground.

title: n_(pokemon)
body:
Lead antagonist of [[pokemon_bw|Pokemon Black and White]], and supporting character in [[pokemon_bw2|Pokemon Black 2 and White 2]].

He is the "King" of [[Team Plasma]]. He regularly challenges the player character, [[Hilbert (pokemon)|]] or [[Hilda (pokemon)|]], in order to confirm his ideas of justice. He calls Pokémon "friends", but he wants to split humans and Pokémon and divide them to create a black and white world, as he wanted to set Pokémon free from people (who he viewed to be their oppressor), and looks for the power to bring his idea to reality. 

He returns in the sequel games to help thwart the schemes of his father, [[Ghetsis (pokemon)|]], who has formed his own Team Plasma with the intent of taking over Unova by force.

Full Name: [b]Natural Harmonia Gropius[/b]

title: see-through_clothes
body:
Clothing or fabric that is partially or fully transparent, whether because of thin or sheer material, or because it's [[wet]].

Should not be used with [[covered nipples]]. If you can see the color of the nipple, it's [[see-through clothes]]. If only the outline is visible, it's covered.

title: olha_(aege-kai_wo_wataru_hana-tachi)
body: Olha is one of two main characters of the manga [[aege-kai_wo_wataru_hana-tachi|Aege-kai Wo Wataru Hana-tachi (Flowers Crossing the Aegean Sea)]] created by [[Hinoshita Akame]]. A young from Qirm (Crimea) who was sent to marry a soldier's son in Geneva, Olha arrived there to find that the son had died, and is now making traveling east to find her sister, who she hopes has fled Qirm form Crete due to war with the Ottoman Empire. This journey inspires [[lisa_(aege-kai_wo_wataru_hana-tachi)|Lisa]] to join her, and together they begin traveling in search of Olha's sister.

A young aristocrat from a merchant family in Ferrara, Italy who dreams of traveling the world, Lisa befriends the other main character of the story, [[olha_(aege-kai_wo_wataru_hana-tachi)|Olha]], and together they embark on a journey to Crete.

title: janus_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the [[Royal Navy]] J-class destroyer HMS [i]Janus[/i] (F53). 
Character design by [[konishi_(koconatu)|Konishi]], voiced by [[Ozawa Ari]].

h4. Appearance
As a J-class, she is dressed and geared identically to [[jervis (kancolle)|Jervis]], the only difference being that she is [[left-handed]] and that her gear is always painted like Jervis Kai.

Like Jervis, she is also a [[blue_eyes|blue-eyed]] [[blonde_hair|blonde]], but her hairstyle is quite different: Medium-length hair curling and rolling inwards (making her look like she has shorter hair) along with [[parted bangs]], the right-side bangs also being feathered.

Her characteristic smile in "her official art":[/posts/3618172] has been compared to the gooey goopy grin of a [[slime_(dragon_quest)|slime]] in the [i][[Dragon Quest]][/i] series.

h4. Trivia
She is named after "Janus":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Janus], the Roman god of doors, time and more. Her name is pronounced as in English (JAY-nus) and not as in Latin (YAAH-noos).

h4. J-class Destroyers
* [[Jervis (Kancolle)]] (F00)
* [b]Janus[/b] (F53)
* [[Javelin (Kancolle)]] (F61)

h4. See also:
* "Wikipedia: HMS [i]Janus[/i] (F53)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMS_Janus_(F53)]
* [[Janus (Azur Lane)]]
* Her other sisters:
** [[Juno (Azur Lane)]] (F46)
** [[Javelin (Azur Lane)]] (F61)
** [[Jersey (Azur Lane)]] (F72)
** [[Jupiter (Azur Lane)]] (F85)

title: masu
body:
A [b]masu[/b] is a square wooden [[box]] originally used to measure rice. Today it is used to drink [[sake]], and to carry beans for [[mamemaki]].

h4. See also

* [[Sake]]
* [[Sakazuki]]
* [[Tokkuri]]
* [[Choko_(cup)|Choko]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Masu":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Masu_(measurement)]

title: mamemaki
body:
[b]Mamemaki[/b] (lit. "bean scattering") is a ritual performed on [[Setsubun]] in which [[soybean|soybeans]] are either thrown out the door or at [[oni]] to drive them away.

The square box in which the beans are held is a [[masu]].

h4. See also

* [[Setsubun]]

h4. External links

title: chen_qianyu_(arknights)
body:
A playable operator in [[arknights:_endfield|Arknights: Endfield]].

[quote]
Chen Qianyu is a specialist operator of Endfield Industries.

She began martial arts training at a young age and later joined the Yinglung Special Task Force. Her experiences endowed her with outstanding combat capabilities and a mental fortitude rarely seen in people her age.

No matter the situation or circumstances, this optimistic girl will always stay true to herself and never give up in the face of adversity.

title: goldenglow_(arknights)
body:
[i]Hairdresser and new Caster Goldenglow, tormented by the cycle of shocking and getting shocked.[/i]

A playable Caster Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Susie Glitter

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Victoria[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]January 7[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Feline[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]159 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]None[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

An aspiring Victorian hairdresser with electric-based Originium Arts, the sixth child of the large Glitter family.
After the events in Caladon City, she joined Rhodes Island under the recommendation of [[quercus_(arknights)|Quercus]], [[grani_(arknights)|Grani]], and Bitter Root.
She currently works as a beautician at Rhodes Island hair salon. 

At the end of the 1st Anniversary livestream for the CN version of Arknights in mid-2020, a post-credit sequence teased then-upcoming operators [[Thorns (Arknights)|]], [[Surtr (Arknights)|]], [[Saga (Arknights)|]], [[Archetto (Arknights)|]], [[Mountain (Arknights)|]], and Goldenglow. Despite appearing alongside them, by the time of the 2nd anniversary a full year later, she alone remained unreleased, her name still unknown. Speculation ran rampant on why she hadn't appeared yet, even leading to her being misidentified as a Perro rather than a Feline. It wouldn't be until February 8th, 2022 that she would be finally announced properly, class and named included, to appear at the mini event [i]A Light Spark in Darkness[/i].

Despite her ears, her motif is based on [[cat|Cats]], specifically the [[Scottish Fold]].

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Sakura Ayane]].

h4. Skins

* !post #7018212: [[goldenglow (maiden for the bright night) (arknights)|Maiden for the Bright Night]]
* !post #7152576: [[goldenglow (summer flowers) (arknights)|Summer Flowers]]
* !post #7727639: [[goldenglow (party in the garden) (arknights)|Party in the Garden]]

title: satomi_touka
body:
A character in [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]]. She is one of the three leaders of the Wings of Magius and best friends with [[hiiragi nemu|Nemu]] & [[Tamaki Ui|Ui]].

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[bangs]] & a [[side braid]]. As a [[magical girl]] she wears a [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon]], [[red bow]], [[wide sleeves|wide]] [[frilled sleeves]], [[frilled collar]], [[black thighhighs]], [[fur-trimmed coat|fur-trimmed]] [[black coat]], [[frilled skirt]], [[corset]], and [[black footwear]]. She is usually [[holding umbrella|holding]] an [[umbrella]].

She is voiced by [[Kugimiya Rie]].
